They are definitely the top brand on the market. Picture quality, design, UI, and features are all top of the line. This model (6400) is superior when compared side by side with all the other brands out there in the ~$1000 range.PROS - Great Smart capabilities. Easy and quick. No bugs after 2 months of use. Pleasantly surprised when Netflix streamed a 3D movie in 3D and the glasses became useful (never planned on using this feature).-Amazing picture. Cant say it enough. I work in the AV field so get to see this stuff a lot but can honestly say that this TV hits the mark on picture quality.-Audio is high quality after tweaks. It puts out plenty of power to fill my apartment. Sounds good across multiple sources.CONS- No VGA input or audio in. Yes, I believe that VGA should still be an input in this day and age. Or at least an Audio in in case an old MacBook only outputs video over HDMI.-Remote. Touch screen is flakey for scrolling. No quick.Overall I would give this a 4.5 but will round up to be nice since I really do not have a problem with this TV.

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN40F6400 40-Inch 1080p 120Hz 3D Slim Smart LED HDTV
Reviews.Author: Lawrence Russell
Reviews.Content: This is my second Samsung LED TV as we have a smaller one in the bedroom which has given good service for about three years, so I stuck with Samsung on this purchase. The setup was easy right out of the box and the picture is great. The TV speakers are adequate, but I hooked it into my surround sound system which is much better as you might guess. I haven't tried a 3-D movie yet, but checked out the demo trailer on the TV and it does work, but don't expect movie quality 3-D. The glasses are a little gimmicky and have to be synched to the screen, but as I say, they do work. My only minor problem so far is with the remote. Remember, these TV's are now computers, and this remote has a pad to move the cursor around the screen to access the different functions. It is rather small, and if you unintentionally move your finger across the pad, lets just say you get unintended results. I hooked the TV to my Comcast remote and can get most of the results I want from that. I am not an engineer, so I can't give any numbers to support my review, just that I'm happy with the picture and sound and the results I have had so far.

Reviews.Title: Very good hardware.  Minor issues with software & remote.
Reviews.Author: J. Grant
Reviews.Content: This is a preliminary review.  I just got this "TV" (Samsung UN40F6400) a couple weeks ago so while I've tried most of the features I got the TV for I haven't explored everything.  Also, I don't know how well/if the RF/cable features of the TV work at all.  I gave up on Charter, the only cable TV company in town, a long time ago and RF reception isn't so great here so I basically don't watch "TV" at all anymore.That said, it is a good "TV".  I love the micro-dimming and the overall picture quality.  Built in wifi made wireless connection to the LAN very simple.  The TV is light enough that mounting it on the wall was easy for me to do by myself.  (Though I wouldn't try that with a larger model.)  It works well for streaming content from the 'Net and over the LAN, and that's what I got it for.  It isn't as great as my WDTVLiveHub at playing oddball file formats or recognizing foreign characters in file names, but I do like the plug-in ("app") architecture and the built-in web browser, and it works well enough for what I needed it for that I'm happy with my purchase.  90% of my video will play on this TV, and being able to get rid of a few cables by retiring the WDTV is a Good Thing.  Hardware-wise this is a very good TV.!!NOTE!!  Kind of off-topic, but if you're a fan of running your own video server this TV does DLNA out of the box (via "allshare") and there is a "Plex" app in the Samsung store that will let your new Samsung TV be a client to a plex server.  I've done that to allow the TV to connect to a plex server on a Synology NAS on the LAN here and it seems to work well.  (In fact, as I type this review I'm watching the TED "channel" from the NAS on the TV.)One thing that I've noticed on the Samsung is that the TV remote's controls feel a bit.. off.  The trackpad is great for doing things like controlling the cursor in the web browser, but it feels like the rest of the TV's software was built for a different remote without a trackpad.  Things that I can do on my LG TV in the other room with one button on the (admittedly huge) remote are sometimes just a bit more involved - or at least not as obvious - on the Samsung's more modest hand-sized remote.For the most part this is just a bit awkward however.  Nothing a software upgrade or two can't fix, and really just a nitpick.  If they fixed the file name display and expanded the list of formats playable via USB and over the LAN then I'd give it 5 stars.One thing on the wish list that would put this TV over the top for me would be to have a bluetooth (or even wired) auxiliary audio output for my hard-of-hearing mom that DOESN'T mute the speakers or disable the audio out on the back of the TV.  That way she would be able to watch TV with the rest of us by letting her adjust her private audio levels to suit her own needs without it being so loud it forces the rest of us to the other side of the room and annoys the neighbors.  This is something *NO* TV maker seems to care about, but I'd trade any of the marketing/checkbox gimmicks (3D for example, or voice) for something like that in an instant.  If you're listening Samsung....

Reviews.Title: Great TV but Delivery Isn't What I Thought!
Reviews.Author: Amazoner "Average Joe"
Reviews.Content: I'd been looking at this television for quite a while and had seen similar models on show floors, so I knew what I was looking for when I decided to purchase from Amazon.  I bought the UN55F6400 for the bells and whistles and so far, haven't been disappointed.  I've had the TV on for approximately 4 hours thus far and will be tweeking it for a while to get it adjusted the way I want to view.  I'm awed so far at the vibrant picture and anticipate great viewing in the future.The only gripe I have thus far is the initial shipment by Amazon's third-party deliverers.  It was my understanding that the contractors would deliver, carry into your home, unpackage, and turn the TV on to verify there are no major issues.  Didn't happen!  These two guys pulled up in a rented van, hopped off, had me carry one end, set it in the doorway, and informed me they had done their job and weren't allowed to go any further than they had.  I tried to call Amazon, but was hung up on twice and on the third call, the foreign-toned voice acted as though they didn't know what in the world to say.  After realizing the folks from "where-ever" weren't going to be of any help, I decided to go ahead and unpack the TV and test it.  Fortunately, the TV worked fine (so far) and am having no problems.I will post on this later after I have had more time to enjoy it!27 Nov 13:  The more I learn to tweek the setting on this set, the more I am enjoying it.  Maybe I was too use to my 8 year old LCD Sony, but the picture on this set is amazing!  I initially had the cable box connected to the set using the RGB cables and I was noticing some hesitation during fast movement, but later installed a HDMI cable from the box to the TV and WOW, what a difference.  Fluid motion no matter the action.  I also have figured out that the IR extender can also change the cable box with the Samsung remote.  That is also important to take advantage of what a "Smart" TV can provide.  I'm really beginning to like this television!

Reviews.Title: Great TV, but lousy software for watching online content
Reviews.Author: Norexan
Reviews.Content: Buy this TV because its a great TV, but don't be persuaded by the Smart Hub feature. The Netflix app forgets my username and password everytime I turn off the TV without exiting the app first. The Amazon Prime app has a clunky, dated interface. I actually like the Smart Touch remote quite a bit, but the apps are clearly designed for use with older remotes and reference some of the legacy colored buttons which this remote lacks. For example, to add an Amazon Prime video to my watch list I have to pull up an on screen remote control and navigate to the missing button using the touchpad. This TV has shut off on its own at least twice in the first week I've had it while trying to navigate around the Smart Hub interface. I would venture to argue that most of the problems other reviewers have mentioned are caused in one way or another by Smart Hub. Although it's a pain in the neck for now, I bought this TV for use with Xbox One and I will never use Smart Hub again after I get my Xbox. However when using it as a standard TV I am very happy with this purchase. The video quality is second to none with a razor sharp image and excellent color and black levels. The plethora of image calibration options let me tune the picture exactly as I want it. Highly recommended, but only if you have separate hardware to serve up your online content.

Reviews.Title: Super satisfied customer right here.
Reviews.Author: Matthew Patton
Reviews.Content: Amazon had a quick delivery to my front door quickly. I did a lot of research to find the best TV for some very specific specifications that I was looking to meet. The product descriptions they had on their site made it easy to make the right choice for me. When I opened the box and started putting the TV together I knew then that I had a great quality product. The picture was sharp and clear. The on screen set up was easy to follow and complete. The hook up for my Direct TV and Blu-ray player was a breeze. I'm happy with what I got.

Reviews.Title: Best features for your money including micro dimming and 3D
Reviews.Author: Michael R.
Reviews.Content: Perfect addition to your living room for anyone that wants a great value and every feature you need for HD and 3D viewing. The micro dimming feature and 480 CMR rating (which I didn't see in the description online) gives you the absolute best picture quality you can have in a great HD slim line model. I've read the reviews that mostly indicate that the 3D features aren't all that useful, but viewing any recent Blu-ray HD DVD with 3D truly puts you "in the movie" with this TV set. There's nothing wrong with 3D features, it's like comparing apples to oranges: those movies and documentaries that have been made in the past few years have far superior 3D technology than those made prior to about 2010. You're not just seeing things "pop out" of the screen, it's a total immersion experience with recent releases in 3D! I can't recommend this particular model any higher, it's simply one of the best of the current models by any manufacturer.

Reviews.Title: TV was great until it started turning itself off and back on multiple times for no reason
Reviews.Author: Steven Wayne
Reviews.Content: I bought the TV through amazon warehouse deals, the TV's condition was excellent, you would have never known that it had be returned before!  Right out of the box the TV worked great, the WiFi connection however is very spotty on the TV and at times worked when it wanted to.  Once you setup the TV with the correct settings it was a pleasurable view!  Unfortunately after owning the TV for about 2-3 weeks the TV turns itself on and off multiple times for no reason!  At first I thought it might be a temperature issue with the TV, however this started to happen immediately after first turning the TV on.  Thank goodness for Amazon's return policy as this TV is going back and I am now going to by an LG Electronics 47LA6900.  I sure hope I get to keep this one longer than 3 weeks!

Reviews.Title: Wow!
Reviews.Author: VBSurfer
Reviews.Content: Upgrading from a rear projection HDTV (topped out at 1080i).  I did a lot of research on LCD vs Plasma and once I settled on LCD (because I have windows in my living room), looked at a bunch of different TVs in store and via online review.  The Samsung was clearly the best LCD model.  Then I had to choose which model in the line and I settled on the 6400 not because of 3D, which I don't really care about, but because of micro dimming.  The shipping and unboxing through Amazon was very good.  They called day before my appointment to confirm and then that morning to say they are on the way.  Verified it was working and undamaged which it was.  The TV picture is incredibly bright and stunning.  The color out of the box definitely was off and need to be adjusted.  I found calibration settings and once I put those in the picture is just jaw dropping.  Football, tennis, golf all locked great with no lag or glitching.  The picture even seems to have a lot of depth to it which suprised me.  The past couple nights watching TV (via DirecTv) I find myself distracted from the show by the details in the picture.  It's really that good.  I also briefly looked at some BlueRays and the picture looks even better.  Not sure if its the upgrade from 1080i to 1080p or the TV but wow!  Not sure I even need to see a movie in a theater now.  Off center color degradation was mentioned in a review but I don't think its that bad.  Doesn't matter that much to me as I'm usually viewing it from center anway.  The only small compliant I have is in some TV shows the black in the night scenes looks a little smeary and washed out.  I did not see that effect on BlueRays so at this point I'm going to attribute that to the broadcast.  The SmartHub has some good stuff but I don't really care about that.  I'm sure I'll get around to looking at some 3D since DirecTv has 3d channels but that doesn't really matter to me either.  I was looking for the best picture I could get to watch sports and movies and this TV delivers in spades.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic picture!!
Reviews.Author: Anthony Richard Angione
Reviews.Content: I just got this television two days ago and the picture is absolutely gorgeous. The color is bright and vivid right out of the box. Sound is good out of the box in standard mode, not great, but its excellent in the clear voice and amplify mode. 3D is very good although can be a strain on the eyes after a while (don't wear it for long periods). Have it setup on my new tv stand that I just purchases to go with it so good to look at. And saves so much space in my room now to. Love all the features that come with the smart tv as well. No problems hooking up with WIFI in my house and connecting to internet with facebook, twitter, or any apps at all. And having two free pairs of 3D glasses to boot so I don't have to buy them separately; nice.

Reviews.Title: "Just buy the Samsung"
Reviews.Author: Jess
Reviews.Content: Had a Samsung prior to this one for 5 years decided to upgrade and tried to save a little money so we bought a Vizio a boy did that tv sucked.We returned the tv due to severe flashlighting in the corners of the tv and went ahead and spent the extra money on the samsung it was like night and day.I realized you just have to spend the extra cash for quality when it comes to these tv's.The picture quality is outstanding with really deep blacks pretty good for a led tv with very vivid color something that you always get from samsung,the 3d is really good but i must admit i didnt see a big difference between active and passive 3d glasses.However the netflix on the tv keeps losing signal and hope a firmware update would take care of problem.Overall not a bargain by anymeans but you cant go wrong with samsungs.

Reviews.Title: I got the recommendation on this TV 42 years ago and just didn't know it.
Reviews.Author: Michael E. Whatley "mewcomm"
Reviews.Content: As a kid fresh out of the Army in 1971, I went to buy my first stereo. I recall the sales guy pulled me aside and said, "Look, $300 will buy you 90% of the state of the Art". "People spend the next one thousand, two thousand, five thousand dollars chasing the last 10%.These days, in the Digital/HDTV (3-D) and coming 4K era who knows what that 90% number is for a television? (Is that what they're still called?).  Still, I'm going to hazard a guess that around $1500 buys you 90% of the "state of the art"  (Non-4K) for most consumers.And the UN556400 at $1300 is a stunner.  Spectacular image display and performance.That sales guy from 42 years ago, influenced my gadget purchasing  throughout my life. And I think he'd agree with the choice of  a Samsung UN6400. If it's not 90% of the state of the art, I don't care!!!!  It's a Maximum fun HDTV!!!  Laughs!!Cheers

Reviews.Title: Great overall
Reviews.Author: Brandon Carson "Shemp65"
Reviews.Content: Great overall, but the app screen isn't very customizable, and some of the apps don't work with my cable provider (not Samsung's fault). I got a good price on this TV, and am enjoying it so far. I'm not getting as sharp a picture with my AppleTV as I had hoped for... but that could be Apple's issue.

Reviews.Title: In Love!
Reviews.Author: LCS007
Reviews.Content: Buying a TV, at least for us guys, is an emotional decision that starts with logic. What's the refresh rate, do I want 50 or 55 inch, 120 or 240 hz, and so on. The next step we often look to is Customer Reviews. We try to find someone that seems to have more expertise or "logic" than we do and go from there. Well I did all of the above and then decided, "Hey, it's a Samsung!" Gotta be good, right? So much for logic.So here's the bottom line. Once I discovered the nuances of my Samsung, dialed in the settings I wanted (don't ask, total trial and error) I could not be happier. The picture clarity is outstanding but does adjust according to the source. For instance my setting for watching a Bluray. The TV remebers that setting and then switches when I go back to TV. Pretty cool! I've found my best picture seems to come from Hulu but it could just be me. Oh, I watched football this weekend, over the air HD quality and I cannot believe the picture.Now about the 3D. It has it. Nothing exceptional there. If anyone has some ideas on what to watch or your better experience I would love to hear from you.My setup currently uses no home theater (want to contribute?). I use the latest ROKU, a Panasonic BluRay player and over the air TV. I subscribe to Netflix and HuluPlus and we have an Amazon Prime account.We recently went to NYC and the picturres from my iPhone 5 were very good on the computer. The I looked at them on the Samsung and WOW!So far my experience with Samsung has been exceptional, would do it again in a heartbeat. I also purchased the Square Trade extended warranty, 4 years I believe. Just a little extra insurance and they get great reviews.HAPPY VIEWING.

Reviews.Title: Great TV!
Reviews.Author: PC Guy
Reviews.Content: Pros:1. Picture quality.2. Sound is above average for built in speakers.  I have it in an average sized bedroom.3. Smart TV features4. Thin bezel5. Easy to set up.Cons:  NoneThe remote is unusual.  Small and thin with a touch pad.  No number keys.  It also has a microphone.  The mute button is on the side.  All buttons are backlit.Amazon delivered in less than three days.  Very happy so far.  Samsung and Amazon rock!

Reviews.Title: Quality Control Issues...
Reviews.Author: DemonWarp
Reviews.Content: I've had the 75" version of this TV for 5 days now...  I gave it 3 stars, but 2.5 stars would be more fitting.  This could easily be a 4-star, even a 5-star TV if not for some serious quality-control issues.  I have two small splotches on the back side of the screen glass, can't clean them.  They're slightly brown in tint, my theory is they are stray drips of adhesive.  The material that diffuses and reflects the edge-light from the LEDs is uneven, creating larger patches or "cloudiness" as many call it.  In addition to that, the left side of the screen has visible ripples in this material which present themselves on bright images or if I stand more than a few feet to the right of center.  Very distracting.My first impulsive response to these issues was to simply return the TV and exchange it for another.  But I had not taken the time to fully explore it yet or even wall-mount the TV, so I figured I'd do a little research and playing with the display.  I have since viewed this model at two separate Best Buy stores, as well as the next model up of Samsung 75" -- the UN75F7100.  The two other F6400 model 75" TV's I've viewed show the same problems.  Not identical, one of them did not seem to have the ripples, but still had the cloudiness and showed light-leakage or flashlighting in the corners -- something mine does not do.  The other had the same cloudiness and similar ripples, only on the right-hand side.  So, I fear that if I exchange the TV for another, I'll just have the same issues.  The first one without the ripples also had a visible brown "glue spot" on the back side of the glass.The 65" and especially the smaller versions of this F6400 line don't seem to have the issues.  Probably easier to assemble the smaller units with the chosen screen materials.I have contacted Samsung tech support -- a worthless endeavor.  They don't have any clue what I'm talking about, but agreed my issues sound like defects and they can send out a technician for warranty repair, which I think that would be pointless.  Or I can work through my dealer (Amazon in this case) to exchange it.The F7100 model of this TV seems to use a different backing material behind the screen.  It did not exhibit the ripples or the same level of cloudiness.  But it is also 40% more expensive.  I am seriously considering sending this TV back for the F7100 model...All that said, the TV runs well.  After a few requisite adjustments -- tone down the backlight, turn off the auto-motion blur-reduction garbage, etc.. it works well.  The Smart TV features are very usable on this TV.  Netflix and Amazon instant work as good as on the new Roku boxes, although not quite as snappy.  The remote for this TV is fine in concept, but everyone in the house finds it frustrating.  We have a larger automation system in place, but don't have the new TV programmed in yet, will probably do that in the next few days.  Then I can control from my phone or tablet or whatever.  I guess I'm waiting on that to see if I'm keeping the TV.Overall, this TV had better highlight preservation and detail vs. my other potential choice -- the Sharp 80" '857U.  The Sharp seems to do better in terms of not having splotches or ripples, but the light really falls off in the middle.  Not only that, but 75" is the sweet spot for screen size in our family room -- 80" would be a bit big and we're replacing an old 70" that was fine, before it died, but a touch too small.Anyway, If there were no ripples and the cloudiness would go away, this TV would be wonderful - 4+ stars.  These large screens, or even all screens as far as I'm concerned, really need to be full-array back-lit.  Edge lit LED is always a compromise.  So now I guess I'll keep watching the TV to see if I can make peace with the clouds and ripples or if I'm going to spend another $1500 + the time it takes to swap for the next model up.  And no guarantees there either that I wouldn't have similar issues.Delivery from Amazon via Pilot Freight was simple and smooth.  Would definitely do that again.EDIT >>I had the TV swapped out.  Still some cloudiness visible on all-black or near all-black screen images, but nothing out of the ordinary for large-screen edge-lit displays.  Everything else about the replacement unit is as it should be.  This TV has a great picture overall.  I still think there are some quality control issues that Samsung needs to address and until we move away from this current trend of edge-lighting, there are going to be aspects of these TVs that are more a compromise than a great feature.  I've upgraded my review to 4 stars.  The TV would get 5 stars if they could produce sets without the clouding...One other nitpick.  The optical output on the back of the set is not in the inset port area and with a low-profile wall mount, I had to use a 90-degree adapter.  The ethernet jack is also a straight out the back ordeal, not a big deal here as I connected via wifi, but just a couple things to think about.  Curious design decisions...EDIT 2 >>There are some real annoyances about this TV that just won't go away.  It has a bad habit of reverting picture settings every now and then for no good reason.  I have to go back to the menu and re-tweak backlight and brightness and other color settings back to where I want them, along with Auto Motion settings for the horrid motion-smoothing.Annoyance #2 is the TV audio output, which I only need to use for the Smart Hub apps.  Doesn't matter if I use HDMI ARC or the optical out, results are the same with either.  All works fine, however when bringing in 5.1 channel audio from Netflix or Amazon instant video, the audio frequently drops-out for a fraction of a second and at random, but very frequent, intervals.  Only does it with 5.1 channel audio, if I go into the audio options for a Netflix movie and change from 5.1 to stereo, then it plays fine.  Samsung has acknowledged this issue -- after several attempts of getting through to someone who actually knows something.  Got one of their senior product specialists to finally acknowledge that they're aware of the problem and it affects several TV models.  However no word on if or when it will be fixed.  He seemed to want to point the finger first at my installation as the audio passes back to a Yamaha RX-A830 receiver, then at Netflix, but it happens with the Amazon app as well and presumably others.  And I have also found the same streaming audio glitch with the 55" F9000 4K Samsung TV passing audio back to a Denon receiver.  OTOH, this is not a deal breaker for me in any way because I don't really use the apps or smart features.  We do watch a lot of Netflix, however we do it through the Oppo Blu-Ray player as it provides fully functional 5.1 audio on the Netflix titles that have it and it has superior picture decoding compared to the app in the Samsung TV.  Other systems like the PlayStation3, AppleTV and Roku all support working 5.1 audio from Netflix, not sure why Samsung is having troubles here.

Reviews.Title: Great picture
Reviews.Author: Thomas L Pearson
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv because I wanted to simplify my tv systems.  I had 4-5 remotes, tv, cable, soundbar, Dlink, DVD.  Also couldn't get Amazon streaming with the Dlink.  The Samsung remote works everything.  It takes a little getting used to but you can figure it out pretty quickly.  I was a little worried by some of the reviews about trouble streaming Amazon videos but I've had no problems.  The picture quality is fantastic.  The sound is pretty good, better than my old tv with a soundbar.  I have bad hearing and still need earphones to hear dialogue clearly with movies but the tv speakers do a decent job with dialogue.  I'm not a big fan of 3d but I was pleasantly surprised with the quality of the 3d and it's fun with come movies and my grandkids enjoy it.  I also picked this model because it has 4 HDMI inputs so I can get HD hookups from the cable box, DVD/VCR, blu-ray 3d and have one left over, maybe a game consul.  The tv is everything I expected and no problems yet.

Reviews.Title: i like it as gaming , almost perfect for this price range
Reviews.Author: Abdullah "Mahfooz"
Reviews.Content: i like it , cheaper , and all functions, i use LG before , 2 times and Phillips but Philips picture still better ,but less availability and expensive here in bangkok,,,, soo i go for samsung.,.. and its nice

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Vadym Charkovskyy
Reviews.Content: Not what i expected of this tv! Its works, colors are great, but smart system is very slow, just like iPhone 3 have to wait a lot after every move, internet browser extremely slow even with LAN cable connected to very high speed internet. Disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Smart Touch Remote, a big minus.
Reviews.Author: ROBERT V EMMERICK
Reviews.Content: Great TV.  3D is excellent on this TV.  The stand seems a little flimsy.  I was shocked to find out this TV will play FLAC compressed audio.I hated the smart remote that came with it.  I bought a standard remote Samsung part number AA59-00594A to replace the remote control.  I am much happier with this replacement.

Reviews.Title: Quality LED TV
Reviews.Author: GJIII
Reviews.Content: I love this television. The black levels are very good. The remote can be tricky to use especially the voice commands and lack of physical number keys. The swivel stand is convenient. The 3D feature works although most 3D movies are not worth it not even at the theaters. I like the tv control integration with my time warner cable box and samsung soundbar which connects seamlessly. The tv can not control the TiVo premier box.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the Price
Reviews.Author: donna cermak
Reviews.Content: My first HD TV! Funny, but I use it more for U-Tube, Pandora, the Web, Amazon and Netflix than actually watching the TV.  My only comment is that the preset TV Picture settings (dynamic, standard, natural, movie) just didn't quite look right.  They were either too sharp, too dull, too bright and shiny, or too artificial. Once I custom calibrated one of the settings, though, the picture looks gorgeous.  Would recommend a Samsung TV; they're great.

Reviews.Title: Love, love, love this TV!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Candy
Reviews.Content: Love this TV!  Amazing picture!  Great smart hub but make sure if you buy this to immediately update to the newest  software version from nov 27, 2013 to get faster, better streaming.  The update will take about 2 hours but well worth it!  I cannot say enough great things about this tv.  Remote is like a computer, swipepad to scroll, well placed buttons, voice activated, hundreds of loaded apps!  Love it!

Reviews.Title: great tv, HDD problem
Reviews.Author: remsej
Reviews.Content: The only problem with this tv is that it doesn't support 1TB HDD connected through the HDD usb port, there's no problem with lower capacities HDD

Reviews.Title: Great, but far from Perfect
Reviews.Author: LeKy411
Reviews.Content: I bought the 65 inch model. It is a great looking TV, but I am not sure it met my specifications 100%Overall:The TV looks very sleek, the build looks solid, the remote is cool looking, the setup was a snap. The initial image was rather BRIGHT, the sound was to be expected from such a thin structure and probably tiny speakers. Overall it is a nice looking set. The screen material is shiny and I wondered if that would annoy me at certain times of the day. Auto Motion is a Samsung gimmick. It makes the picture look Soap Opera-y and text appears to shake. Not a fan of that so I turn mine off. 120Hz is more than plenty.Good:The TV is rather intuitive in terms of setup. It located my devices rather easily once plugged into HDMI. The Sony home theater in a box connected right away and the external speakers functioned well once I realized that a receiver needs to be in the ARC HDMI Port.My Comcast Box connected easily and the remote picked up some of the functions rather well. Not perfect, but gets the job done.Image overall is clear when running 720 or 1080. Standard signals don't look so great, but it is expected with such size.The built in speakers are decent for a 15by25 room with vaulted ceilings. Not much base, but it works.Bad:The default settings are not stellar. Movie is the best setting, but finding someone online reviews with settings makes the image much better.When the room is dark, there is some bleeding of light on the edges. Not terrible, but it is present.Clouding is also present with default settings when the screen is pitch black. Adjusting the settings does help the situation and KEEP IN MIND this is a common issue with LED TV'sThe remote could function better with the Comcast box, but it is not a substitute in anyway.The remote lights up, but you still cant see the writing, only the buttons. So it doesn't really help much.The applications don't run quickly, sometimes they lag even with a wired internet connection.The TV is not perfect, but for the price point you are getting a good mid level TV. This TV has both positives and negatives. I am not rating the 3D aspect because that is a personal preference, but I enjoyed it on this TV. The two pairs of glasses are nice and you can get another two pairs for about $50

Reviews.Title: Love IT !
Reviews.Author: Rodman
Reviews.Content: My first smart TV and I just love it !  The size is just right for my bedroom ( where I have it ), could have worked for the living room as well.  I will probably buy another slightly larger size for the living room though, but if not 40" is enough for me.  It was money well spent.  I wish it were a little less expensive, but you get what you pay for !

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: John Galt
Reviews.Content: We love the quality of this set. We got it in the 40 inch size to retro fit into a TV cabinet. The picture is outstanding and the set is definitely feature rich.The only issue is with the complexity of the remote. First it is rather small and the touch pad is required for many functions.Like most things, I am sure we will like it once we develop the touch. However, I would rather not have to "Train" in order to use my consumer electronics.

Reviews.Title: Samsung TV review
Reviews.Author: Marjie Scahill
Reviews.Content: I love this television. Picture is spectacular. 3D option is awesome. Product is lightweight and easy to move into place. Setup was simple and nearly automatic. Easily connected with Samsung 3D Blu-Ray player. Smart TV is smarter than I am and will take some learning. I now need a wireless keyboard for ease in typing information.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the money
Reviews.Author: S. Coper "saxophile"
Reviews.Content: I looked at several TV's at stores before purchasing this.  New models come out in March, so with a little internet research, I settled on Samsung as a good brand and this size to fit a limited space cabinet.  Very good picture quality, 3D capable, and 1080p.  The 4K won't be out for a while yet.  Great choice for your needs now.

Reviews.Title: SAmsung Smart- TV
Reviews.Author: cmaonthepc
Reviews.Content: LOVE IT. it is an unbelievable  tv. The picture is liek you are in the room with the show. We are still learing all the other featurs, but it is womderful, would buy again, no hesitation.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: P.
Reviews.Content: This T.V. is great I love it. the picture is wonderful. It is just what I wanted it to be and then some.

Reviews.Title: Great picture & features but Samsung's Ecosystem is Restrictive
Reviews.Author: M. Oren
Reviews.Content: This TV has a great picture (I can't really speak to sound since I use Samsung's soundbar), and the feature set is great (although I don't really care about the 3D feature, my nieces love it when they visit). My only real complaint about this TV is that Samsung is overly restrictive with their ecosystem. It has a screensharing feature, but unless you have a Samsung smartphone or tablet which is very disappointing since I was hoping to cast video from my Nexus 7 to it (at least until Samsung finally releases the Xfinity app). Minus that one annoyance though, I've found that it works great for watching Amazon Video, Netflix, Hulu, and regular TV/blurays.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: roddick
Reviews.Content: TV overall is great. I got with free blueray so i think it was really great deal. Researched a lot and finally bought this tv. Ii think there are few problems with all share. When i try to play photos from my laptop using all share it randomly switches to cable tv.

Reviews.Title: Great picture, avg sound
Reviews.Author: Travis W. McCoy
Reviews.Content: Researched this very well, and am very happy with the picture.  I haven't used the 3D yet, but couldn't be happier otherwise.  The sound was average, so I went ahead and went with a sound bar with subwoofer with much better result.  Only complaint so far is that when using external speakers (soundbar), when you adjust the sound, it pops up an alert message every single time, not a big issue, just a mild bother.  Otherwise, it's great!!

Reviews.Title: Get it!!
Reviews.Author: DeltaKilo
Reviews.Content: I am well versed in research and technology.  I spent hours upon hours researching this TV, and others.  This is the 4th Samsung TV I have purchased, and all of my others are still working.This TV is amazing, and once you get it home, you won't be able to tell the difference between this one, and the F8000.I didn't think I would use, or even care about 3D, but man, when me and my wife put on those glasses and watched some of the 3D stuff that came with it!!!!!  whoa!!!  We make all our friends try it out when they come over.Amazon's white glove shipping is great, the guys were right on schedule, and they called the day before, as well as the day of the delivery.-Keep your box, just in case you have to move, ship it back, etc...-Google some TV calibrations for this model for picture set up-Glare is average, like a matte finish.  (we have 2 very large windows in front of TV)-2 person set up-Netflix/Amazon Prime Video work great, with great HD picture.Get this TV!

Reviews.Title: No so GREAT!
Reviews.Author: David Gasch
Reviews.Content: Picture on this TV is excellent.  However, in about a week this unit started shutting off and on by itself.  Very aggravating!!  I called Samsung and after the third call, I finally got them to send a repair company to fix this.  I'm still awaiting the repairman to come, which is tomorrow and hopefully all will be fixed.  I probably will not purchase another Samsung product.  I also own a Visio and LG TV set and they have given me no problems.  I cannot recommend this TV.

Reviews.Title: samsung un65F6400 65" 3d tv smart led
Reviews.Author: William R. Bacon
Reviews.Content: bought a lot of tv, this is the best of them all. best picture I`ve seen, 3d very good. and every thing has been working great sense I got it in July. I`ve had Comcast here to fix my cable a few times and when they see the tv they are amazed at the great picture. I have my playstation and 2 dvr and computer hooked to it all work fine.if your looking for a nice tv this is it. Had the 82" Mitsubishi the picture wasn`t near as good looking as the Samsung, not even in the same ball park. the Samsung 2d-3d is a very nice thing to have also. Makes the movies I`ve seen before look so much better. I kind of wish I went with the 75" the 10 inches would make it even better. So if your looking for a tv try the Samsung F6400 good price and I don`t think you have to get the higher priced f7100 or f8000 there pretty much the same thing besides the price.'

Reviews.Title: Worth it big time
Reviews.Author: JoeJoe "joejoe"
Reviews.Content: I purchased the 46" 6400 to replace my LCD Samsung that started clicking after 5 1/2 years.  It still worked, but I knew it was going to be an issues.  Later research showed it was an easy fix if you could solder (I can), so I was worried I bought a new TV for nothing.  Turns out, I am so glad the clicking started. :) The TV is just amazing.  No large surrounding bezel, and the picture as well as the sound put the LCD to shame.  I love the smart interface, and I use the apps a lot, especially YouTube.  I have it hooked up to my iPhone so I can read the pairing icon on screen and voice the YouTube search I want and it plays on the TV.  Sick!!  I get Streaming video uninterrupted over my linksys.  I also got the Samsung Blu-ray player for nada.  Such a Deal!!  A couple of important points.  There is a firmware update dated June 18th, and an instruction sheet dated in May.  You should be able to update through the TV menu, but if not, you can do it via usb memory via the download.  It fixes a number of issues, including the wireless disconnect.  I have played YouTube video in HD for hours with no hitches. The Blu-ray player is very touchy.  I had I DVD that would not play, and one that skipped.  I ended up washing them with mild detergent and warm water.  Played perfectly afterward.  So don't give up on the player.  One last thing, the connections are located on the right side of the TV as you face it, which is opposite my previous one.  Be prepared to get longer cables.  I have my new set  hooked up to Apple TV and Roku, as well as a couple other DVD players.  All work fine.  If you are looking for a TV, this one is great.

Reviews.Title: purchased in June 13
Reviews.Author: Paul Kirouac
Reviews.Content: The 2D picture is wonderful. I have not tried 3D yet. The set up was easy and the internet access is quick and simple.

Reviews.Title: Best TV I ever owned
Reviews.Author: McShopper "Kevin"
Reviews.Content: Bought this TV as the PS4 is being released this year and I wanted the best for my gaming. Based on the reviews I knew I was getting a great TV, but when I hooked it up I was completely blown away. It is amazing all the things this can do. Little things like it auto adjusts the brightness based on how bright or dark your room is, and it works well. Streaming from Netflix and Vudu works better than expected, and there are so many other apps I cannot wait to test out. The best part is the picture, it feels like I am looking out a window, it feels like 3D without the glasses, I have yet to try the 3D yet but can't wait. I could not be happier with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: An amazing picture at an incredible 75"
Reviews.Author: Anthony P. Moody
Reviews.Content: I want to give this 4.5 stars but Amazon doesn't allow that... Anyway, for what amounts to Samsung's entry level 75" set, the F6400 is incredible. Starting with calibrated settings for an F8000 found on the AVS Forums (where I posted far more extensive thoughts and findings), the picture quality is excellent.Black levels are good to very good, motion handling very good, no clouding, and simply "wow" overall. I'm very pleased with the picture quality.Like all TVs these days sadly, there are a few shortcomings, primary among them is flash-lighting.  On my set it's primarily on the left edge. However, in all but the darkest 16x9 content it's not an issue, and even with dark stuff not enough for me to return the thing.  With 21x9 content it's more noticeable because of the black bars, but again not overly objectionable especially since the picture itself is so good.The other issue is that the set is fairly reflective. Have to break down and finally buy some window treatments for my room. Fortunately the room lights don't get picked up on screen, though the glossy bezel is another matter. Simply a poor choice on Samsungs part. I'm seriously toying with the idea of black felt tape over the bezel...Very happy overall!

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for...
Reviews.Author: ssaslow
Reviews.Content: I purchase the VIZIO E701i-A3. The reviews were great for the most part so I figured I would try the set. Out of the box the picture was washed out. Colors were not vibrant. I read many forums that recommended different settings and tried them all. Still the picture was not up to par with my other sets (which are all Samsung by the way). I did not really want to spend almost $4k on a set but ultimately I decided to purchase this. As soon as I plugged it in and turned it on I knew I made the right decision. As with all of my other Samsung sets the picture quality was amazing. The colors are bright, sharp and vivid. There is absolutely no comparison to the Viso. Visio was returned. I will never make that mistake again. I hung this on the wall with a Sanus LL11 low profile mount in 30 minutes. Absolutely stunning purchase. Sometimes you actually do get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: Not so great experience with this tv
Reviews.Author: Andrew S. Hernandez
Reviews.Content: Unable to access the smart hub feature. Once connected to the Internet and moving on to step two of the process it gives a "having trouble message contact Samsung support center". Did and they were unable to fix the issue. The picture quality was not as great as my last Samsung led TV. I will be returning for another, hopefully this was just a bad TV out of the batch and not a bad model.

Reviews.Title: Ultra Sharp Rich Image, Web Internet Not All It Should Be!
Reviews.Author: Love Technology
Reviews.Content: I just purchased this TV from Amazon on Amazon.com this past week.  This TV is replacing a 1 year old Vizio tv.I purchased the TV prior to Memorial Day so I went back and checked and Amazon is now including the Samsung Blu Tooth keyboard as a promo for customers that purchase the TV from Amazon the seller. So I called up Amazon and they comp-ted me the $89 keyboard since it was less that 14 days from when the TV shipped. Nice, very nice.The TV is very nice, colors are very nice, and due to local dimming the blacks are very dark.  Switching between cable channels is very quick, unlike the Vizio that could take up to 8 seconds.Internet access is not all it could be.  If you think you are going to watch all of your Internet streaming video on this TV it's not going to happen! I was able to stream video's from pbs.org without a problem.  But I am unable to stream the "Ready For Love" series from NBC.com.  The video never starts, nothing.  For me it wasn't a problem as I have an Acer W700 Windows 8 tablet that I used to stream video via HDMI at 1080 x 1920 to the TV. By the way I did install the Samsung update for this TV via the Internet so that is not the problem...I really think that the local dimming really makes the blacks really black.  Yes you will pay more for a Samsung but you really do get what you pay for.  My days of purchasing Vizio products are over.Setting up 3D, assemble glasses, insert battery.  This hardest part is figuring out that you have to hold down the sync button on the glasses until you see a message on the tv that the glasses are paired to the TV.  There really is no way to indicate that process using their picture only direction sheet!3D works OK I can detect that the lens are switching on and off but it's not really that noticeable. I really wanted passive 3D as offered by Panasonic and LG so I was intentionally not planning on purchasing a Samsung.  But when my requirements list was completed it turned out that Web surfing using a usb or blue tooth keyboard and local dimming as offered by Samsung made it an easy decision to change my mind and get this TV.  The reality is that when I had the Vizio I only watched 1 3D movie in the one year that I owned it.  So most likely I will not utilize 3D that often with this TV set.  I have read that the sync signal emanates from the bottom part of the picture frame and that having a sound bar in front of the TV will interfere with the sync signal reaching the 3D glasses.  I can report that this is not an issue with my Sony sound bar sitting in front of the TV.All in all this TV is a quality offering.  If the web browser was able to play all formats of streaming content from the Internet then this TV would have earned 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: In home theater experience!
Reviews.Author: G. Martin "soixantaine"
Reviews.Content: Samsung UN65F6400 65-Inch review.Bought thru Amazon w/ white glove delivery. Arrived in 7 days with the "free shipping" option! Only one man showed up as his partner was sick that day, so it was my pleasure to help him out & unpack/set-up and take my time looking it all over before I signed off, without feeling rushed! Worked out great!This replaced a 2009, 52" Sony which is now in the bedroom, and I might add still works like a champ and a picture that I'd thought I couldn't better!Not that this Samsung betters the Sony, but is newer, brighter, Bigger, and both have such great picture quality I'd hate to bet on which is better than the other!Now I got this because of the size, as I wanted a "even more larger" theater experience in my living room, as movie going has become much less over the past few years and Home Entertainment, with the Blu-Ray experience, and "instant VOD features" and streaming of films in 1080 has become my new movie going experience.Back in 2009 when I bought my Sony I was also comparing a Samsung that was my preference {which had over 850 reviews} but a common problem {s} was sound issues and the TV turning itself on/off automatically; so I opted for the Sony which hardly had any complaints!I was comparing to Sony again this time but their new model is 60" or 70" in 3D, but no TV stand that swivels. A swiveling stand is a must for a TV this large and Sony dropped the ball on its new releases. Plus in the 60" and under I was to understand wasn't even an updated panel {s}. But this new 2013 Samsung is a whole new animal for 2013 even though this model is like tier three-ish.I read what little reviews I could find, visited two "Big Box" stores where I actual saw this 6400 model and the 6300 and could see immediately that the 6400 has blacker blacks and better viewing angles with hardly any "wash out". The 6300 and 6350 where looked at but has no 3D and for this kind of money and the small difference in price to have 3D which I'd never seen before, not even at the movies {that's right; haven't seen a 3d movie yet} I opted for 3D and this latest model.Ok, you're probably getting tired of my story by now so I'll get down to the nuts & bolts of this review; which is all about PICTURE PICTURE PICTURE!  And that is just as good or great as I think one can expect from any HDTV!Many TV's now have very good pictures; LG, Sharp, Panasonic, Sony, and it can be a tough call when visiting a Big Box store and start looking at em' all!In my comparisons, side by side Samsung had an edge over the rest. Plus I wanted the latest model!The media hub/Smart TV and the touch pad remote are all new to me, except my Blu Ray player has the media stuff too, the remote I've become use to already after just a few days and works well, but there are so many options to picture that until I "bone up" on all these new facets, I'll just stick to what looks "good to me".The sound I have no complaint about as nothing obvious sticks out or sounds bad to my ears. I have my stereo system I'll be hooking up later for those Blu Ray movies but day to day, it'll just be the TV speakers!That's about it, picture and sound. Smart hub and more features than I'll ever use! {my wireless was found during set-up and haven't had a re-buffer as of yet with over 10 hours on Netflix}The looks and design are very nice, and the TV stand is well spread out on four "spider legs" that seems very stable and measures 32" long X 15" wide, holding a TV that's about 58" long and 2" deep! But living in California I have plastic chain {doesn't conduct electricity} and toggle bolts in the wall all hooked to the back just in case the Terra firma ain't so Terra firma one day in the future!My living room is about 22' in length with chairs or sofa at either end and I can turn this TV enough to watch from either end without loss of quality on viewing angle.All in all, I'm a happy camper at present and hope to continue to be.But... on electronics I always go for and extending warrantee.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful TV. The smart features work well though I ...
Reviews.Author: Charles O. Darney
Reviews.Content: Beautiful TV.  The smart features work well though I don't use them much.  The 3D capability was not important to me in choosing the TV but since it was a feature I've used it.  It's very nice.

Reviews.Title: junk
Reviews.Author: travis j atherton
Reviews.Content: so 3 months after i bought this tv it turns it self off and on over and over cant use its trash. out 1600.00 dollars. not happy

Reviews.Title: Nice...
Reviews.Author: joemaamah
Reviews.Content: I've bought my last 4 Samsung flat screens from Amazon and the never disappoint. I really wasn't in the market since I just got a 40" 120Hz TV a couple summers ago and was very pleased with it. Unfortunately my mounting bracket pulled out of the cheap sheet rock in my house, and that TV was destroyed. This was bought as a replacement. First let me touch on the 3D stuff. I've only toyed with it a bit and I think it's little more than a gimmick. But the glasses provided synced up with the TV quickly (once I read the manual - DUH!) and the effect is very vivid, to say the least. What really impressed me about this TV though is how much better the 2D is compared to the TV that dropped off the wall. That TV was no slouch by any means, but this one seems to have much more vivid hues and looks so much better for high action movies and sports that I suspected they slipped me a 240Hz by mistake.I also use this as my PC monitor and it is spectacular in that regard. Nothing like 40" to make you forget your eyes are getting older. I like to play a couple games (Diablo III and Torchlight II) and the old TV would show some "jaggies" when the action was getting really intense. No such problem with this monitor. It's like I was in he middle of the action.So while this was an unexpected expense, I'm more than pleased with the upgrade.

Reviews.Title: TV broke in 4 months. Poor service from Samsung.
Reviews.Author: Saurabh Singhal
Reviews.Content: After 4 months, TV went into a rolling reboot mode. Called Samsung. They said they will send someone to replace the motherboard. It took 6-7 weeks for them to send a technician. Didn't expect this quality and service from Samsung.

Reviews.Title: Nice picture but TERRIBLE for watching shows on the internet
Reviews.Author: Anne R.
Reviews.Content: This TV has a good picture and as a TV is good. We were hoping that we could watch TV shows directly from CBS etc using the browser. It just doesn't work! Using the same internet connection my smartphone works fine. My old laptop works fine. The TV gets jammed when ads load and randomly stops playing if you wait long enough for the the ads to actually get played. Very disappointing. Youtube videos do seem to work OK especially when you use a phone or computer to control which are played.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful and Stunning
Reviews.Author: Russell R.
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, stunning, and functional.  I'm in love with my new TV.  The picture is great and it's very easy to set up and use.  Very few color and picture adjustments needed from the default settings.  The sleek and slim design are especially welcome and the Smart Touch Remote is a nice addition.  The smart TV portion and apps are good but I rarely use them as I have so many other devices that do the same, and more.3D is okay but not why I purchased the TV.  3D is a dying fad.

Reviews.Title: Not sure where to begin
Reviews.Author: Lee White
Reviews.Content: Being this is my first venture into HD and TV's that can't fry your morning eggs I'm probably a bit biased but I have watched enough on friends TV's to know that this one is an excellent choice. The first thing I had to do was turn down the brightness. With LED back lighting it was far too bright as set from the factory. This is NOT a bad thing since it was easy to locate the settings and change.The hardest part to get used to was the VERY small remote. It has a rather serious lack of buttons most of which are replaced with a touch pad. Once I got used to it I was rather surprised at how well it works. Keep in mind that the most used remote I have is to my cable DVR which comes with a universal remote.For my living room this is about as big as I could go without having to move my head while watching. Did I mention the fact I love this thing?! :)Very thin but with enough heft that it's obviously not constructed cheaply. It recommends having two people to set it up but I couldn't wait and did it by my self. After removing the obvious bits from the top of the carton I laid the box down with the front of the TV facing the floor. I then cut the back of the box away from the sides and bottom to get it out of the way. With the carton laying on the box my TV stand was shipped in I attached the bottom stand and then gently lifted the TV to an upright position.Once it's in this position you can squat, pick it up from the bottom edge with the edge in your palms and place it on your TV stand without worrying about mashing the front with your fingers. Worked like a charm and had me back watching TV in no time.Even backlighting and brilliant colors - a very good choice and with the faster refresh motion is handled quite well.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME
Reviews.Author: VIOLET BURGESS
Reviews.Content: Before i bought this i  read every review i was so happy with result you get everything in one television the picture is awesome infact every thing about this television is .There nothing bad i can find wrong.

Reviews.Title: This TV is great
Reviews.Author: Amy Kaskiw
Reviews.Content: I didn't want a super bowl left over. I wanted a TV with the latest features. (Of course in a week something better will come out.)The remote is different and much improved from past Samsung TVs. The Smart Hub is also improved. I hooked up a flat antenna to it. The channel guide for these free channels is really good.Great picture and great features. Amazon even got it here a day early!The 3D classes aren't that great; you definitely can't wear them over your own glasses. Otherwise I'm completely satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Great picture.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Great picture. Also have the 7000 series with even better picture. Would like to see 7000 series available in a 40 inch.

Reviews.Title: Amazing picture but....
Reviews.Author: Mark A. Myers
Reviews.Content: The color and definition on this TV are amazing but every once in a while images on the screen, like people for example, will start shaking wildly like they are having trouble staying in this dimension. And sometimes you get that Soap Opera look which I've heard is associated with LED TV's. We like watching 3D movies in combination with our Samsung 3D blu ray DVD player and the glasses work well but they don't want to turn off very easily. I usually have to pull the battery.As far as how smart it is? It automatically switches to HDMI 3 when the DVD player is turned on so that's good but using the on screen keyboard with the remote tends to take a long time. A dedicated real keyboard or even a mouse would be more useful. And most of the services available have monthly fees (Netflix, Hulu Plus etc.) but I have pulled up You Tube videos with no problem.

Reviews.Title: very pleased!!!
Reviews.Author: scott
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my son & he loves it! He watches movies, plays games & does things on the internet! Nothing beats a Samsung product! Very happy & satisfied with it & very pleased with Amazon with the price & the shipping! Thanks Amazon!!!

Reviews.Title: my first big screen
Reviews.Author: RUBEN E RODRIGUEZ VELASQUEZ
Reviews.Content: My first big screen. Top quality TV for a good price. The receiver extension for the remote is priceless. I would defetely recommend this TV even for a small bedroom

Reviews.Title: Outstanding television!
Reviews.Author: K-Dogg
Reviews.Content: This is my first Samsung and it replaces/upgrades a 2 year old 46" Sharp 830series so the picture quality is similar, but the Samsung has a little bit better black levels & a better refresh rate that has almost eliminated blur and also no Soap Opera Effect or Judder with the auto motion plus settings set to CLEAR. Also in my book the only missing apps are NHL Game Center Live (Available through my ATV, Roku, or computer) & NFL Game Rewind (NFL's fault, but available through my computer). Supports ARC & has stereo mini jack and optical audio out for older or non-ARC receivers. Also has 3 USB 2.0 ports for external media and supports AllShare for sharing media from handheld device and supports HDMI-CEC. I wasn't looking for a SmartTV, but when I compared side by side the picture quality was just a little bit better on this tv over the 6300 series so I went with this tv. I would recommend this tv to anyone looking for a 55" tv with great picture quality.

Reviews.Title: Better than I expected
Reviews.Author: George F. Gross
Reviews.Content: This TV has so many features it is impossible to cover them all. Picture quality is superb (full 1080p). It has the capability to produce a 3d picture with a 2d input and you can vary the 3d depth. Not as good as watching 3d from an actual 3d source, but impressive none the less. I have my Satellite box, 3d Blu-Ray player and PC connected to it. I had some problems with the PC connection. I couldn't get a good quality picture, but, I didn't follow the instructions completely. You can't use the HDMI output from you video card to the TV. Text becomes fuzzy while the background looks sharp. It is due to some scaling effects from what I have learned. The proper connection is from the DVI output from your video card. The DVI cable then goes into a DVI to HDMI cable adapter supplied with the TV. The HDMI then goes into HDMI port 4 of the TV and port has to be set to dvi cable. The instructions that come with the TV describe how to do all this, but don't warn you about the quality you will get if you don't.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: anony
Reviews.Content: For the price this television is perfect. I really enjoy the 3D feature as well as the smart tv interface.Voice recognition is a plus and DLNA is perfect for my lifestyle. This television is definitely an upgrade from the old format socially and viewing wise.All I can say is welcome to our future.

Reviews.Title: Love it!!!
Reviews.Author: Nazeli
Reviews.Content: We got this from our registry as a wedding gift and absolutely LOVE IT.  The TV is so crisp and clear.  The first time we turned it on I was in awe of the crispness and the color of the screen.  And you really can't go wrong with samsung as far as tv and phones.  If you're contemplating, don't.  This is the one and it is the perfect size for my eyes.  Love love love it. I also love the fact htat I can watch my netflix directly from the tv...no more HDMI connecting cables, I just open the app and watch my show.

Reviews.Title: Second one we bought.
Reviews.Author: Emilee C. Haskins "EV1"
Reviews.Content: This is the second 3D Samsung TV I have purchased. The slim LED's are great, the picture is fantastic. Wi-fi works with no problems (streaming movies). I did have a failed remote on one of the units, but Samsung replaced it for free.We purchased the slim led so we could fit it into our cabinet- worked great. The slim LED's are less wide than the tv's with the big bezels.

Reviews.Title: Gorgeous picture, irritating remote.
Reviews.Author: Connie
Reviews.Content: Purchased this tv a few weeks ago.  I'm very pleased with the quality of the picture, and it is stunning on a 75" tv.  Watching a Blue Ray or even streaming HD content is superb.  We are coming from a 55" LG Plasma, so we do notice a bit of a dim look during the day, or when there is ambient light in the room.  Still not a problem, because if we watched more during the day, the settings can be nuanced to make up for the room lighting.  Not too interested in the 3D, but it is a fun novelty. We tried it with the glasses, and they are actually more comfortable than I expected.  There is not much 3d content available, so we'll probably lose the glasses before we try it again.  The reason I dinged a star on my review, is the remote.  I think Samsung missed the mark with this overly complicated, non-intuitive, too smart for it's own good remote.  Someone said they couldn't access their cable box with it, and that is no longer the case.  However, in order to access your channel line up from your provider, it takes four steps from the first screen to where you are seeing your normal channel guide.  If you try to use the channel list available without accessing your provider's guide, you end up being thrown back to the first channel on the guide every time you exit your current choice.  I'm getting used to it, but one of my kids was so frustrated, that we worked on re-programming our original cable company's remote until now that is all we need to use.  That complaint being aired, i should say I did a LOT of research, and  I would still choose this particular set over any other I've seen in this size for this price.  The picture is worth a thousand words!

Reviews.Title: Great picture
Reviews.Author: Lobogirl
Reviews.Content: I love the picture and set up was easy, but my guide doesn't work with the cable box. There is a planned upgrade that will allow it, but it's been several months, and I'm still waiting...

Reviews.Title: Wonderfull
Reviews.Author: Clark Fritzsch
Reviews.Content: Even if it is not the newest model in the Lineup, its a great TV for a great price! I can recommend it truly!

Reviews.Title: excellent tv
Reviews.Author: Rion Symon
Reviews.Content: i give the tv 2 thumbs up. i love this tv and i would recommend it to anyone. try it out and experience the beauty of samsung

Reviews.Title: Good TV with a few minor issues
Reviews.Author: Frank S
Reviews.Content: The TV is good; resolution is great, and the setup is easy. Internet connectivity is good (aside from the issue below). Some minor issues:+ Closed Captioning is only available if the input is component of HDMI. I can't use an AV input and see captions.+ The TV forgets the WEP password when turned off. It is a bit annoying to re-enter the 15-character password each time I want to connect to my other devices.+ Screen mirroring only works on Samsung mobile phones.

Reviews.Title: Exactly what I thought it would be
Reviews.Author: Dan
Reviews.Content: I have been in the market for  a tv for awhile.  Finally, pulled the trigger.  I have not been disappointed.  It comes ready to watch right out of the box, and VERY easy to setup.One thing to note, I do not like the auto dimming feature, as I feel the brightness gets too low when the room is dark.  So make sure to turn off the eco sensor(Go to Menu: System: Eco System).  I also turned off the energy savings as well as I like a brighter picture.Great TV for the price!!!

Reviews.Title: Amazing, Simply Amazing...
Reviews.Author: Ray
Reviews.Content: Perfect buying experience, everything work & looked as described & most of all the price could not be matched.This television is awesome perfect picture quality & amazing 3D capabilities!!!! Would defiantly recommend to anyone looking for a smart tv.

Reviews.Title: Sharp TV after a few modifications
Reviews.Author: Richie Deschamps
Reviews.Content: I ordered this TV after living with a perfectly good 37" Vizio set for seven years. There was nothing wrong with that set, it's just the advances made in HDTV sets in that time span (not to mention the massive price drops) made it clear that it was time to upgrade.First - picture quality is amazing after toying with some of the picture settings. Everything is super sharp, and sometimes even 2D images pop off the screen. But please do humanity a favor and disable "Auto Motion Plus" as soon as you turn this TV on. Or at least know that you shouldn't watch films with this setting on. It produces the dreaded Soap Opera Effect and will cheapen the look of all those nice Blu Rays you bought, and annoy your friends. Just turn it off. Now. Thanks.Second - 3D. I'm not the biggest believer in 3D, but I figured I play enough games that it might be something I want in the future. Not to mention that Samsung TV's are one of the few groups of devices that can play Netflix 3D movies. So as long as you already have a Netflix account, right off the bat you have a pretty hefty library of 3D films to choose from. And the 3D on this TV truly is amazing. Very little ghosting effect, and even when there is ghosting, your eyes sort of tune it out after adjusting to the picture. I also discovered by accident that this TV can convert any 2D image into 3D. It's a novelty effect that I doubt I'll utilize often for regular TV, but for video games that don't actually display in 3D, this is a really amazing feature. I was playing Call of Duty: Ghosts on the Wii U in 3D for a couple hours yesterday and it was pretty impressive. Of course, because it's converting 2D to 3D, sometimes the effect is a little weird, and watching native 3D content will always be better.Third - SmartHub is a little slow to load menu items. But I haven't run into any problems streaming Netflix, HBO Go or Amazon Instant. Once I start a movie, it plays seamlessly in beautiful HD. There is a nice selection of apps, and I could definitely see the Samsung App store do some amazing things. Fingers crossed for a Philips Hue integration app.Fourth - The remote. It's not a bad remote, but I really have no use for it as I use a Harmony Smart Control remote already. I've tried the voice control a couple times, and it works, but I doubt I'll ever use it in my day-to-day life.Overall, I'm truly happy I went with this set. I've always been envious of Samsung displays, and I know it was a good investment.

Reviews.Title: ahhhh snap
Reviews.Author: az stunnaskillz
Reviews.Content: Super dope tv remote is annoying with no number buttons or arrows and the stand is a little flimsy but other than that awesome tv

Reviews.Title: GREAT TV
Reviews.Author: P. Triana "Pete"
Reviews.Content: I own 3 Samsung Tv and I love this one and am looking into purchasing another. I am not a fan of story telling so i will list out this review for you guys.Pros:CEVA did a wonderful job on delivering safe and sound3d is fantastic better than my UN55D800color is spot on perfectblack are deep and richno flash lighting or parallel barsmany many apps to choose frombuilt in processor has a quick response time on appsWiFi receiver id fast and responsiveyou can download a remote app for you tablet or phone for better remotesyncs with other Samsung devices2 3d glasses in the boxCons:some off angle viewing issues but not too badneeds a detail calibration to get best qualityremote is small and touchscreen but could use some of the tradition buttons

Reviews.Title: This is the best TV I have ever owned
Reviews.Author: J. Coulter
Reviews.Content: This TV is a rock star.  It is by far the best TV I have ever owned.  The picture quality is incredible. I previously had a top of the line Samsung Plasma and this LED blows the doors of the picture on my plasma. I never thought I would use the Smart TV features because I have a Tivo and a Western Digital TV live hub media center already on my network.  Boy was I wrong.  The smarthub interface on the TV is great and I use it every day.  I can see all of my digital media on my network through the Smart Hub interface. Further, I have PLEX installed on my network and I downloaded the PLEX app for smart hub and this combination is fantastic. PLEX allows me to see all my digital media on my Western Digital Live Hub as well as on my computer all in one place.  PLEX automatically downloads all of the Movie info from the Web for all of my digital movie files so I am presented with a "Netflix like" menu of all of my movies through the PLEX app.  The interface to Vudu and netflix is also top notch.  Much better interface than watching from my Tivo or my Western Digital. The only thing I can think to write that is negative at all is the sound from the TV internal speakers is just okay. I run everything through a digital receiver attached to a surround sound system so this is not an issue for me.  If you are debating about buying this TV, just go ahead and do it. You will not be sorry.

Reviews.Title: TV Good; Remote is awful; Rating reflects the TV picture quality.
Reviews.Author: Terry Tooley
Reviews.Content: The picture is very good.  This is a tertiary TV so it is not used much which turned out to be good.  The remote having the touch pad is almost unusable.  We were to the point of returning the TV when we discovered the app for the iPhone.  The app allows you to type in the channel number and go directly to that channel.  The remote forces you to use the on screen key pad.  If you are slow in getting to the numbers, it assumes you are finished and goes to what number is displayed.  Your other choice is to scroll through every channel to get to the one you want. Poor user interface.

Reviews.Title: Great picture, but problems with upgrades
Reviews.Author: Yvonne Folan
Reviews.Content: Recently purchased this TV (40 inch model), and overall very happy, but a couple of points to consider:1.  Although the web browser works adequately, this is not a computer or laptop.  We purchased the additional wireless keyboard, but there can be a frustrating lag on response time, the browser's interface is clunky,and we find we are still going back to our laptop for any serious internet searching or communication.  Frankly, the standard remote that comes with the 6400 is so intuitive and good that the separate keyboard is probably not needed for just internet searches, etc.2.  As we already subscribe to a cable package (Xfinity) and did not want to have to pay another $10+ a month just to get the cable to work directly on this TV, we had hoped to view all our channels instead through the internet (as we can do on our laptops or desktops).  However, this TV runs on the Linux operating system, and comes with Adobe Flash 11.2 installed.  The Xfinity internet viewing app requires the latest version of Flash (11.8) for most of the channels to work.  However, according to the Adobe website (and our numerous attempts to download the latest version of Flash), Adobe is not supporting Linux beyond the 11.2 version -- which means we can't use the Xfinity app on this TV!  There is probably some workaround we haven't figured out (like slinging the signal from a laptop), but the lack of upgrades to Flash is frustrating.Picture quality is amazing, and there is plenty of content otherwise available through its Wi-Fi connectivity, but if you are considering this TV for its Wi-Fi enabled internet experience, recognize that there are some limitations to what you will be able to do online.

Reviews.Title: The Grand Centerpiece to the Home Theater Extravaganza Experience
Reviews.Author: Maximus
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv about 6 months ago through Amazon, so here is a write-up with 6 months of experience with it:The picture quality is excellent, the best I've ever had.  I highly recommend Samsung, I previously bought a 50 inch 2012 Samsung for the bedroom and have been very happy with it.  I did a lot of research and decided to go with the 6400 model.  I think this is a great value model, because this model is the lowest priced model that starts  including a lot of the upper end features.  I also recommend getting the 3D tv even if you're not going to use the 3D.  I read somewhere where the 3D tvs put a higher demand on the video processing, so the tvs are forced to have higher grade processors to compensate.The picture quality for regular TV is excellent.  We've only watched one 3D movie so far--Avatar.  An unbelievable spectacular visual experience.  I had seen the movie in the theater without 3D and was not that impressed.  Having watched it in 3D, I now understood why it's the no. 1 movie of all time--it's the visual effects.We use the Smart TV functions every so often.  The one we use most is Amazon Prime for streaming movies.  We've had mixed response, mainly because our internet connection through the phone company is slow and irregular.  Sometimes it's smooth and there are no interruptions through the movie, other times it is start and stop, which gets annoying.  Once we get an internet connection that matches the technology, that will be great.I've found the voice control to be more useful than the motion control.  The cool thing about the voice control is if you don't know the channel number of a certain channel, you simply speak the name of the channel into the remote and it finds it for you.  Much better than spending time going through the directv channel guide, assuming you can find the channel guide.One other point that needs to be mentioned--the remote control.  It's different than older remotes--there are no numbers on it like most older models, just a touch pad.  I've had no complaints with that radical departure, but to be honest with you, we never use it unless we go to the smart tv.  For regular tv, we control the channels with the directv remote and the volume with my receiver remote.The only reason I am not giving this tv 5 stars is because we had remote control problems.  At first it would not work every so often, then it stopped working completely.  I called up tech. support, and they sent us a new one, no problems ever since.  This mostly concerned our Smart Tv experience.I also recommend getting the Samsung wireless keyboard if you plan to surf the web with this tv.  Moving the cursor over the letters to spell things out gets really annoying in a short period of time.This tv was the final piece in our revamped home theater experience.  We've been very satisfied with it.  I highly recommend this tv if you want to get value and features--a medium priced tv that has many of the upper end features.

Reviews.Title: Great investment for gamers
Reviews.Author: Tyler Higgins
Reviews.Content: Love this smart TV. Does everything I wanted, including 3D. Plan to use it to play on the new PS4.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic picture and sound, for a fantastic price.
Reviews.Author: Jacob Weltchek "NOTWS"
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for an affordable 3D LED TV with lots of extra features, then look no further! Gaming on this TV is an absolute blast!

Reviews.Title: As Good As It Gets!
Reviews.Author: Gerald Schoenburg
Reviews.Content: I've always loved Samsung TV's.  This is my fourth.I have limited space because of a wall unit in my den, which was very expensive, and is also about 15 years old.  The cut out for the tv was intended for a 4:3 TV.  The horizontal dimension limits what you can get in there.  This 50 inch with the tiny bezel allowed me put fit this 50 inch in this space.  The 55 was close to fitting but just too snug,  This was the perfect fit.The entire set up including attaching the stand, tweaking the picture, getting online, and updated was under 30 minutes!  Everything was very easy.  I just connected my Directv receiver and 3d blu ray and I was done.The picture is astounding.  While I use Dynamic for the picture, I toned down the contrast and brighness quite a bit.  Several people have viewed this TV and couldn't believe it was only 1097.  I tried viewing a 3d movie and it was better than the other 3d tv's I've had.The included two pair of glasses were very lightweight and functioned great.  My only complaint is the lenses are too small to fit over my glasses.I'm not too keen on the apps and netflix, but for viewing TV shows and blu rays disks, it is just plain amazing.The pad type remote takes a little get used to, but it's no problem once you get the gist of it.Update 8-5-13.....I'm very unhappy with a small aspect of this tv that most people will say is not important but it is to me. I cannot program my Directv remote to turn the TV on or off, or move the volume up or down.  25 codes entered and none work.  Directv says Samsung supplied the codes to them and if none work call them.  Of course Samsung says it's Directv;s fault and they have no other codes.  So I need to turn the TV and dish on separately and use the tv remote when the receiver is off.  I've had 5 Samsung TV's and never had this problem.

Reviews.Title: My Honest Review
Reviews.Author: Jyothi V.
Reviews.Content: The TV is very  very good. The best in its class.
