I am still getting used to it and there are times when I click the app it takes a while to login to the app and some time it switched back to the TV. but its not a big deal for me.  I noticed one  dead pixel but I am told that it is alright and it isn't a problem for me but I thought Samsung would do a better QA on their products than this.  The  major complaint that I have is that the screws received to fix the base /TV stand are all wrong. The screw measures in the information booklet are different from the actual ones received. Although we fixed the TV it is a little bit wobbly.  I called up Samsung and they shipped me screws for free but they are wrong as well.  I am not sure what to do now.

Reviews.Title: 3d is awesome and smart tvs do way more than i thought and easy to use .
Reviews.Author: Jesse Dupere
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying the 3d looks awesome. I was so worried it would look like that bad tv at best buy i checked out nothing like it way better. This tv is 40 inches and it looked way better everything sticks out good and goes in good because of the crisp colors . I was happy with my 37 inch samsung led tv but I like these 3d movies coming out and wanted to play 3d games on my ps3 so made the change. I am so glad i did really was worried about so many things because of what some people said about this tv . I was reading wifi is slow for youtube and its fast on my tv idk why its slow on theres they must have bad connection or something . I did not know this but all shows can be in 3d on the tv till now its not like the movies 3d but it does make there faces look rounded and much better. As far as my ps3 well im really pleased with the blacks and everything being so black it makes it so in depth and the 3d rocks. I was really worried about the smart tv thing being tuff to understand it took me about 30 min to understand. I have to say i love the remote its awesome and all the cool things you can do makes seeing tv awesome. My number one thing on it is youtube and how you can type with the pad or just talk to it and it types it in. I really enjoy how it knows what shows you seen in the past and will show you them shows when they are on to awesome. I am so glad i bought this tv been looking at tons of 3d tvs i next to never write reviws but i am 100% satisfied .

Reviews.Title: Buyer Beware
Reviews.Author: scott
Reviews.Content: I am fairly happy with this TV and it is a decent TV for the price.  I had a 37 inch LG since 2008 and craved a bigger screen.  I rarely write reviews, but there are some things that you should be aware of before purchasing the Samsung F6400.1.) If you have Comcast (I live in Chicago) then they don't support the HBO GO streaming app.  Comcast also doesn't support the Nat Geo app and probably some others.  Basically you are paying Comcast for HBO, but Comcast can deny you rights / licensing to stream content through the HBO GO app on Samsung TVs.  I heard that it is the same for Roku players.  Search the internet to see if your cable provided is blocking this content if you are concerned.2.) The viewing angle is pretty narrow on this TV.  I have the 50 inch.  If you take one step from the center you will notice a significant drop in color saturation, contrast, and black levels.  The image becomes pretty flat unless you are viewing front and center.3.) WiFi receiver is pretty weak.  I have an Apple Airport Extreme sitting right next to the TV.  But most of the time the Smart content takes moments to pop up.  Half the time, the channel guide will spin for a while before it loads, making it not very useful.  Netflix will also have trouble streaming.  It will stop and buffer and the video quality dips often.  I plugged in an ethernet cable for a solid LAN connection and it 100% fixed this problem.  Once it was connected via ethernet, Netflix looked great.4.) You have no way to customize the television content in the Smart Hub.  It shows you what programs are on and it is supposed to learn and evolve based on what you watch.  But it tends to just show the big 4 channels and some family content.  It would be amazing if I could manually set my favorite 12 channels to populate the main hub screen.  But instead it is kind of useless.  Nicely designed, but worthless.5.) The guide is a nice idea.  It can replace your current cable box guide.  The Samsung IR blaster works very well in fact. I have Comcast and the onscreen guide is fairly ugly.  But with the Comcast box, you can set favorites and customize menus.  Once again, you have no control over customizing the Samsung onscreen guide.  There is no way to set favorites or filter out non-HD channels.Other then that....The picture is pretty good besides the viewing angle issues.There is some really deep control over the picture settings.  So you can finely calibrate the screen.  CNET has great picture settings for this TV.I have Comcast and a PS4 hooked up via HDMI.  Both look fantastic.No 'Soap Opera Effect" if you don't want it.  The image looks the way it was supposed to be seen. This TV handles motion extremely well with out making things look cheap.  (this was my #1 reason for buying this model)The Samsung UN50F6400 is a good TV, but not a great one.  I will probably be in the market for a new TV in another 3-4 years.

Reviews.Title: Nice picture, once you get the settings right
Reviews.Author: Nancy M. "nmaloney"
Reviews.Content: We finally got a Flat screen tv and it's a big difference from our old tv.  Setup was relatively easy  (screws are a very tight fit for the base, but once they go in,  it's a breeze to get the stand on)  When we first set up the tv,  all the pictures look like a soap opera.  I guess this is to make action scenes less blurry,  so if you watch a lot of football,  this is what you want.  We don't,  so it was a google search to find out how to turn it off.  Finally found it,  and the picture is great.  Sound is a little light,  but not bad for built in speakers.  We're still debating about additional speakers for it.

Reviews.Title: 75 Inch - Thin, Bright and Better package
Reviews.Author: R Tangirala "Ramo"
Reviews.Content: I am a little bit hesitant to order this TV online. But Amazon made it possible. I had some clouding issues near corners but when I wall mounted and calibrated, they did not look so significant. This is a thin and fantastic TV for the price. I thought of buying Sharp 80 inch 3D TV instead but liked this thin TV with better picture quality and with a sacrifice of extra 5 inches. Blacks are not great in this TV but PQ is excellent and to my liking. As of today, I am happy with this TV.

Reviews.Title: Stick with Samsung
Reviews.Author: BACB
Reviews.Content: We had a Samsung 50 in. plasma tv which died in May, 2013. We shopped around and purchased a 55in. LG LED smart tv with 3d on the advice of a salesman in a national electronics retail store.  We HATED the picture, especially compared to that our old plasma and a friend's Samsung. It was dark, despite adjusting the settings as bright as possible, the sound was tinny, the picture details were not clear, and sometimes there would be bright quivering images in lit areas of the picture (layman's tern, I am sure  there is a technical term). We returned it, saw an ad for this Samsung, again at a national retail store, and decided to purchase through Amazon.  Excellent price, free shipping, no sales tax and it was delivered 2 days before the estimated delivery date.  The delivery men unpacked it, set it up, and we inspected it for damage, of which there was none. We are very happy with this tv.  The picture and sound are excellent, the navigation is simple, the included wireless keyboard is easy to use, and the 3d is good.  It was easy to pair with our wireless internet.  We've had the tv for about a month now and are extremely satisfied with the quality.  We weren't in the market for one of the much more expensive Samsung models, but we haven't had any issues with motion  blur  with this model.Don't hesitate to buy a large electronic item from Amazon.  The service and delivery are excellent.

Reviews.Title: Nice features, but the user interface is lacking
Reviews.Author: Greg
Reviews.Content: I'll start by saying I am a general fan of Samsung products.  I love the Galaxy note series phones, and have a refrigerator from them.  With that said I was excited to get a new, and my first, smart tv.After using the tv for about 2 months I've discovered the following weaknesses:1) The wireless doesn't work well.  My laptop wireless works great if I set it next to the tv, but the tv has a weaker signal/connection to my home network. Many people have reported problems with the wireless and I finally went to the trouble of ordering a $30 bridge (Edimax N300) so that the tv has a wired connection.  After installing the bridge it became clear that the problem isn't in any other part of my wireless network in the house and the tv now connects well to the internet.2) The TV is SLOW to keep up with commands from the remote.  I've timed it and it can be a delay of up to 10 seconds.  As an example, let's say I want to go to netflix.  I navigate the onscreen menu, but the tv reacts slowly.  When I finally click on netflix I discover that I had pressed and additional downarrow command that the tv hasn't processed yet so it moves off of netflix to the web browser app and then processes the click command (which I thought was to launch netflix).  Maybe they need to include a faster processor in this tv?3) This is a small issue, but the on/off button is directly above the volume buttons on the remote.  So you connect to netflix and go to raise the volume and find out that you've just turned off the tv.  BUMMER!  Now I restart the tv, navigate to netflix and restart netflix...  Yes, I hit the wrong button, but come on, somebody must have thought through the layout of the remote and said what if some lazy guy is laying on the couch navigating around without great cerebral effort?  Well it's hit and miss for this fellow!With all that said, I do like many of the features of the tv.  The remote has an interesting design and works well for many tasks.  There are many apps available.  The TV interfaces well with various HDMI devices, ...In the end I expected a TV that worked more seamlessly and hence my disappointment and lower rating...

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: This is my 4th Samsung TV in 7 years and so far, I am still loving it. Being a long time Samsung user, and having been blown away by previous products, I guess my expectations were set so high that I was not as impressed initially. Don't get me wrong, it has nothing to do with the TV. First of all, I had a working 46Inch 6000 series LED TV which still works flawlessly but needed a bigger TV for the living room. When I connected my satellite receiver to the new 60Inch 6400 series TV, I instantly noticed a somewhat reduction in clarity. I did a few tweaking here and there, but there was no difference. But when I connected a rabbit ear antenna to the TV, the over the air transmission came out beautifully. I then concluded that the signal compression applied by the satellite transmission guys did not do the TV justice.The 3D effect is good, though I rarely set it in 3d mode. I have been able to stream movies from Amazon, home media server, USB stick, external Hard Drive etc and it has worked flawlessly. I have also been able to connect a wireless Keyboard with touch pad (I bought over 5 years ago) to the TV and it worked perfectly. All I did was connect the USB dongle that came with the keyboard to the TV. For the remote, I was initially worried that little remote that came with the TV will be inadequate considering what others have been complaining about, but to my surprise, I really like it now. Its handy, light and you can pretty much do what the bigger remotes can.Something I don't so much like is the dimming of the screen brightness when the ambient light is low. I do like the feature but its very aggressive. I wish the sensitivity can be adjusted.Overall, this is a very good TV and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: i
Reviews.Author: Peggy Ponikvar
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV on October23,2013.  It died last month.  Samsung said they would fix it, the fix it guy cannot come to my home, I live within two hours away from the nearest town.  It has now been over 2 1/2 weeks with no TV, no replacement check and the TV just sits here.  They cannot replace this TV with another one, so they stall you.  DO NOT BUY A SAMSUNG TV.  i I also purchased the wireless keyboard with the TV, they will not give me the money back for that.  I have been on the phone with Samsung for over 3 hours now, they do hang up on you.  I finally wrote an email to the "officeofthepresident@sea.samsung.com".  I will be surprised if I get an answer to the awful customer service this company provides.  Peggy

Reviews.Title: Both of my 40"sets  shut on and off at will
Reviews.Author: NAT "Nat"
Reviews.Content: Both of my 40" sets  shuts on and off at will.  Called Samsung for first set TV that started to turn on and off at will and it took 40mins to have them agree to send out a repair person.  They only wanted to send a new cord??  Repair person came and replaced the two complete circuit boards in the TV and that one is now fine.  I asked the repairman if this was a common problem since I also had a second new one that I had in use for a week and he said it wasn't.  Today the second one started doing the same thing and required and other call to Samsung.  Waiting for second repair call for 2nd TV.  The first repaired one works fine now.  The TV's picture quality and features are very good (3D is great).As of 3/10. Repairman changed circuit boards on 2 nd TV and it is working fine now.

Reviews.Title: Great picture but limited signal output options
Reviews.Author: Steven J. Bell
Reviews.Content: I am impressed with my new 55" 6400 Samsung, the picture being really nice and the smart features implemented well.  The remote works well for navigating menus, though I use my Tivo remote for everyday use and it works quite well with this set.  I cannot say anything useful about the 3-D because I have not used it much, other than the glasses are light-weight and comfortable.Out of the box, the picture was much too bright for my tastes.  I also did not care for the "auto motion plus" feature, which made it seem like I was watching a video game.  But after reducing the backlight setting to 12 and brightness to 30, and turning off auto motion plus, I found the picture to be amazing, especially considering this is a mid-level TV.My one complaint is that the TV has limited options for outputting its signal to other devices.  There are no RCA output jacks, meaning I cannot connect to my analog stereo receiver.  Furthermore, there is only a single optical cable out jack.  Thank goodness it has Blue-ray for cordless pairing with a Samsung sound bar (something that works very well, by the way).  But I know that I am not the only person in the world that has analog stereo equipment and occasionally likes to use headphones- the exclusion of RCA output jacks is a baffling engineering decision, in my opinion, and the primary reason this TV gets four stars rather than five.Otherwise, I am pleased with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV though could be smarter
Reviews.Author: Kent
Reviews.Content: The picture is superb and the sound pleasing. The set is extremely light and should be easy to set up.  In my case it wasn't as my set purchased "like new" thru Amazon Marketplace was missing 8 crucial screws. While Samsung support was rather stingy and bureaucratic, Amazon customer service could not have been nicer in getting me set up quickly. The only longer-term blemish, as other reviewers have pointed out, is that the Smart TV part could be smarter. Processor startup seems a bit sluggish, even with wired internet connection, and won't communicate with iPads, Airplay, or HFS formatted drives, unless say an Apple TV is sitting in between. On the positive side, it's plenty smart about playing Amazon videos and Netflix which is over 90% of what we use if for.

Reviews.Title: Great interface, simple remote and rock star picture
Reviews.Author: Luna Moon
Reviews.Content: It took a bit to figure out how to navigate the menus but once you do you'll love this TV.  No more using the nasty cable company remote since this one runs everything simply.  Also can set it up to show your cable schedule so you can search for shows easily.Most importantly the screen is sharp and bright.

Reviews.Title: Overrated
Reviews.Author: Mule
Reviews.Content: Maybe the smaller sizes work better but my 60" couldn't process fast motion smoothly no matter what settings I tried.  The dirty screen effect was really objectionable during pans watching hockey, soccer and golf.  Screen uniformity issues, over-bright edges and cloudiness in black areas, were unacceptable.  Returning and will try the Samsung PN60F8500.

Reviews.Title: So Use to My Old Samsung
Reviews.Author: C. Lee
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV during the holidays during one of those Black Friday / Cyber Monday specials. It came along with a free Samsung Sound Bar. I thought I got a pretty slick deal on it. As I write this review, it looks like the TV has dropped in price shortly after the holiday season. Boo...I bought the Samsung UN556400 55-inch to replace an old 50 Samsung plasma (PN50B450B1DXZA). My old Samsung had what I call an analog universal remote. I could quickly click any of the buttons. However, the new TV comes with the 'Smart Touch Remote.' Since I got a new Smart TV, I wanted to take advantage of the new features.However, before I get into that, let me explain how my old TV was setup. I had and still have Comcast as a cable provider. In my old setup, I primarily used the Comcast universal remote since I could quickly bring up the channel guide, on-demand, DVR, etc. I would use my old Samsung remote if I wanted to change the source on the TV.With the new Samsung remote on this new TV, bringing up the smart Samsung Guide is sort of a pain. If you click on the 'Guide' button, it defaults to channel 1. I can't seem to figure out if there's a feature to only bring up only the HD channels in the Samsung version of the channel guide. So now I have to scroll backwards through the 900s and 800s to get the HD channels. The on-screen help says I can quickly skip multiple channels by clicking on the "virtual" A button. However bringing up the virtual remote on the screen seems a little cumbersome. With the Comcast and analog remotes, the buttons are readily available to be clicked. With the virtual remote, you have to swipe between screens to get be able to select the proper buttons.If you want to go directly to a specific channel, you can click on the right hand side of the touch pad. Then you can swipe the numeric channels. It's hit or miss. Sometimes it recognizes the numbers and sometimes it doesn't. With the old analog universal remote, you simply push the buttons. I wish the TV came with a better remote that had the new Smart Touch features but also some additional old screen buttons.I also know someone that bought a Samsung LED over the holidays. They opted for a 60" LED but an older generation. It was also a Smart Hub TV. I have to say my Smart Hub came up a lot quicker and was a lot easier to configure. A lot of the common apps were already pre-configured. With the other Samsung LED TV I saw, she had to manually download some apps (i.e.: Youtube) since it wasn't pre-installed.As for the picture quality, the 1080p certainly beats out my old 720i plasma. The picture looks pretty good and haven't had any issues with it. As for the 3D, I played with it for the first two days and lost complete interest in it. One pair of glasses is still in the plastic packaging.Some PROs:* Samsung has an iPhone app to control the TV* It syncs nicely with other Anynet+ hardware (I tested with a Samsung Sound Bar)Some CONs:* The web browser and various Smart Hub features are a little slow and clunky in design* The default display setting almost made me return the TV. I had to change it to Natural since the default setting seemed really, really dim. I thought I got a lemon of a TV.* Some random resets when playing with the Smart Hub features. Meaning the screen will turn black and seems like a quick reset.Still to Play With (and hopefully some updates in the feature):* Compare streaming quality (i.e.: Amazon Prime, Netflix, Vudu)* Ponder to buy a blu-ray player or just subscribe to streaming services only for the best quality video* Debate if I should just go back to the analog Comcast remote and deal with using two remotes

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: Peggy M. Waite
Reviews.Content: beautiful!!!!  if am able to go on to the web, access my email order movies...all in my jammies.  I know nothing!!! about computers and am in my seventies.  if i can do any can!!

Reviews.Title: Meets my lofty expectations
Reviews.Author: manbearpig "Half man, half bear and half pig."
Reviews.Content: This is my second Samsung flat panel TV and my first smart TV. Coming from a Samsung TV, I knew what to expect in terms of picture quality and stuff and I was not disappointed. On the smart TV front, I discovered quite a few things and I shall discuss them here.1. The picture quality is second to none2. In-built wi-fi: makes it easy to connect this TV to your home network. Although, I found out later that its best to use an ethernet cable if you plan to stream netflix/hulu3. Smart hub: is a cool idea but probably needs a bit more work... it can be slow to respond from time to time4. Apps like the screensavers and wallpapers are cool for showing off5. Weather app is very slow and unusable6. Smart/Eco features like auto-dimming based on surrounding light is cool7. TV Remote with is touchpad/clickpad is AWESOME: makes navigating the smart hub as well as surfing channels a pleasure8. TV is so thin that wall-mounting it is the only way to do justice to it9. The screen is less glossy than my previous Samsung LCD10. Screen mirroring is cool when it works: has a tendency to freeze or drop connection from time to timeAll in all, I love this TV for its gigantic size and excellent picture quality. Everything else is just an icing on the cake.

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: Pen Name
Reviews.Content: The best tv I ever had. Very good quality and the internet works perfect. It is just the best tv.

Reviews.Title: Great price for a great TV
Reviews.Author: 49erFootballFan
Reviews.Content: Let me just start writing that I am no TV guru.I wanted a TV that had great picture and would work for every day HDTV, some movies, and video games. I needed something that was 50".  3D was a plus but not necessary. Didn't care for SmartTVs but all TVs of this caliber are SmartTVs.After really considering a number of TVs found on Amazon (Plasmas & LEDs), I decided to go with the Samsung over other competitive brands/models (Panasonic, LG, Sony). Plus, I got a free Samsung 3D Bluray player through the deal as well so check if it is still available!In the week and half that I have owned it... I have not been disappointed.Pros:-Picture quality is awesome!-There is a lot of control with colors as well so you can find a preset that fits you or custom one.-Setup was super easy and the process when you turn on the TV is step by step.-Audio is pretty damn good alone (not perfect, but if you get a TV like this then you should at least get a 2.1 sound system)-3D quality is great! I was not interested in 3D that much but so far the two movies I have seen through it have exceeded my expectations.-Uses active 3D glasses-Super thin and the fact that is competitive LED screen when compared to Plasmas-Fair price for what you get (The 50" model was competitive and only $100 more than a Panasonic model I almost bought)Cons:-Difficult to plug in with standard wall mount (extended are no problems) given plugs locations.  (I can survive)-Comes with only 2 active 3D glasses. I will probably want around 4-6 for larger parties. This may be good though since there are better Samsung compatible glasses on Amazon.If you are in the market for a new TV and have a $1200 budget then consider this Samsung a must. Don't believe me? Read the other reviews. There is no BS here.

Reviews.Title: Good for the price!
Reviews.Author: AWGamer11
Reviews.Content: - 46" LED Samsung Smart TV 120hz- Lot of features, apps, skype ( need to BUY the camera for $79 on Amazon), twitter, movies, netflix, hulu, Amazon video, youtube and so on and on and on...- Mouse pad remote is interesting, most futeristic type of remote I've ever seen- The CABLE picture is good, but I will admit it doesn't compare to my Sony XBR I was replacing (was a 40" model)but I know we're talking two different price points- XBOX 360 looks REALLY clear on the screen, more so than TV.- I don't own a blu ray player, but will update once I have tried blu ray, which should be better than the cable tv signal.UPDATE: movies look GREAT on this TV even on cable signal, but you must sit back...if you sit too close its a different experience!- The TV is THIN...much thinner than any LCD I have owned (LED is quite different!)- If I could go back and do it again, I'd probably go up to the 7 series, which is a few hundred more and includes the 240hz refresh rate, and a few other improvements. If this is your primary TV, I'd consider going witht he higher model Samsung, but for what it is, its a GREAT DEAL...Happy I saved some money and got a solid TV.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding TV
Reviews.Author: Silver Fox
Reviews.Content: So far I am very happy with this TV.  The standard picture is fantastic and the 3D was stunning. The set up was pretty straightforward.  I ran into one small issue when I was doing setup, but I got past that pretty quickly.  I was impressed by the remote as well.  They've really done quite a job with this one.  3D was really a no brainer unlike a passive 3D LG that I was trying to help get to work a few months ago.  I did buy a Samsung sound bar system to use the ARC HDMI and a Samsung bly ray player to avoid compatibility issues, so I don't know how well the TV might work with other equipment.I mounted this one on the wall with a Cheetah Mount and that was a bit of a challenge, but it came out great and mounting on the wall frees up so much space.  In retrospect I may have rather chosen to have it installed because I ended up having to buy metric ratchets to get the mount on.  Note that the TV comes with inserts for the four points to bolt into on the back of the TV that you will need to put in before attaching the mount to the back of the TV. I didn't notice this at first and wondered why the mount didn't fit well on the TVAll in all, I'm a very happy customer with this TV.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful
Reviews.Author: Richard Roush "Adams Addict"
Reviews.Content: This TV has excellent picture quality and looks very good.  I like the thin border design.  Setup was easy.  I have it attached to a Yamaha stereo receiver and Polk 5.1 speaker system, so I'm not using the TV's speakers.  The remote was a bit of a shock, but it turns out to be fairly easy to get used to and I haven't had any real problems with it.  It would have been nice to have a numerical keypad though to be able to jump directly to stations.Based on recent events, I can no longer recommend this or any other Samsung TV.  I have owned two of them- this one and a 46 inch model.  The day this TV was delivered, the main board on the 46 inch set failed.  It started displaying fine vertical lines of color across the full screen.  I replaced it with an LG 46 inch set.  Now, this 55 inch Samsung has gone bad.  My smart remote was not connecting with the TV.  I could turn the set on or off, but that was about it.  I couldn't switch from Cable to satellite, and when I turned the set on, I couldn't expand the Smart Hub window to full screen that was displaying the programming the TV was currently tuned to.  A Samsung technician has just left my home after replacing the main board in this set, which is only a few months old and has received very little use until recently.  He also had to replace the toggle button on the back of the set which allows you to control menu settings when the blue tooth functions of the smart remote are not working.  It's a nice TV when it's working.  Great picture, but sadly, Samsung is now 0 for 2, and that is unacceptable.One other point I should mention.  The technician told me my set should have come with a traditional keypad style remote in addition to the touchpad smart remote.  It did not.  I don't know if Samsung forgot to pack it or if someone from the seller removed the keypad remote from the packaging before shipment.  The touch pad smart remote takes some  getting used to.  If the keypad remote had been included, I would almost certainly have been using it to control the TV and might never have noticed that the touchpad remote's blue tooth features were inoperable.

Reviews.Title: Nice 65 inch screen, 3d looks awesome to me
Reviews.Author: A.B.
Reviews.Content: TV is working fine. My wifi is now overloaded with iphones, kindle, dvd player, laptop & Apple TV. So I am not able to test the cool features. I tried watching ESPN 3d channel that is broadcasted by Optimum. It looked very nice. If the TV source is good, then it looks great. I have international programming which is not upto the mark, so they dont look very nice on this big TV. I dont think its TV fault. HD channels look great. Size is pretty big, only the projector are better compare to this.

Reviews.Title: Smart Samsung 55' screen
Reviews.Author: Marco Gutierrez
Reviews.Content: The quality of images on the TV are amazing. And added to that the 3D experience has been very cool! Having a smart tv makes a huge difference, now I don't have to plug any extra devices (like my laptop) to stream Internet stuff to it.

Reviews.Title: leonard mercurio
Reviews.Author: Leonard A. Mercurio "tv lover"
Reviews.Content: I like everything about this tv.ggreat picture,this is my second Samsung,the bestif you need a smart tv,you cant go wrong with a samsung

Reviews.Title: Great picture, but has issues.
Reviews.Author: sunnyday93
Reviews.Content: Worked great for 2 months, but now having issues with tv turning off and on at random. Either a software or power supply issue.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding
Reviews.Author: F. L. H.
Reviews.Content: Great TV with lots of features, i.e. 3D, Fulll screen web browser, - no pc needed.  Yes you can get a 40 inch TV for less, but if you want top of the line performance with the latest features, put this TV at the top of your list.

Reviews.Title: Too many problems for the price
Reviews.Author: Jmp
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers have mentioned, and I ignored when I purchased, this tv has issues that make it difficult to enjoy, particularly if you use services like HBO Go and Netflix.  HBO Go, for example, seems to have a software issue that causes the wireless internet to completely disconnect frequently, requiring you to exit the app and go into network configurations to rejoin the wireless network.  I had an LG tv before this on the same network and never had an experience, so this makes me think it's a software issue with the Samsung tvs. In the end, I've had to hook up a smart dvd player to use these apps, completely negating the purpose of getting a smart tv.  I suggest either upgrading to an LG model (which have much better remotes) or downgrading and getting something like a Vizio with a comparable picture but drastically cheaper.

Reviews.Title: It goes OFF and ON by itself, among other issues
Reviews.Author: maca.b
Reviews.Content: We didn't like the TV much from the start but we kept it to avoid the return hassle. Slow, often it would freeze, or would show random errors and we would have to go back and start again to reboot the applications. We have had the TV for less than a year and now it will turn off and on randomly, and will alway stop (sometimes) after unplug in for several minutes.We contacted Samsung customer service and they said it has a 12 months guarantee. We have to file a form and such. We'll see how that goes.  STAY AWAY FROM THIS PIECE OF CRAP.

Reviews.Title: Good enough
Reviews.Author: Sintek
Reviews.Content: Fine picture quality, though the pixel shimmer and motion blur could be better, but I blame that mostly on the panel I got. Apparently no 50" uses one of the good panels.Anyway, this is a good television for the price. The smart functions are easy to use, there are plenty of setup and configuration options, and the image processing features seem interesting.

Reviews.Title: Very Good customer service
Reviews.Author: SKG
Reviews.Content: The product is very good, but for the contrast/ brightness which is very high when looked from around 100 degree angle. The sound quality is, surprisingly for a TV, very good.

Reviews.Title: Smarter than we are
Reviews.Author: Electronic gadget mom
Reviews.Content: There should be a class on how to use this TV!  For now it is smarter than we are.  We do like the features we've been able to figure out, such as writing the channel number faith your finger or a direct jump to it.One irritating piece: The remote's mute button is where you normally would hold a remote, making it very easy to accidentally mute the TV.

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: Nance McLeish
Reviews.Content: The TV was delivered well...the men were very helpful.  Together we figured out how to get the TV going.  (every year it is a new trick.)  The visual part takes a little getting use to it but since it is suppose to be like watching a real person, I can accept it.

Reviews.Title: Stop samsung product trash
Reviews.Author: alexander
Reviews.Content: STOP do not buy samsung product if you have warranty they just give you the one-time use services are terrible and are not responsible if the technician damages your tv bad products with the time. white spot on the screen  dont buy Samsun TV I hope it has helped you make a desicion on this waste product if they want photos of the two tv that eh had will gladly sent them do not spend your money in trash

Reviews.Title: great TV
Reviews.Author: EM "EM"
Reviews.Content: The picture quality on this TV is awesome.  The apps work great and I am using my PRIME to get free movies and shows.

Reviews.Title: GREAT TV
Reviews.Author: shopinful
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV for my family room.  Most people probably buy a much bigger TV but this works great for us.  Picture is great and it really is a smart TV.  I am not technical at all and I can work it which says a lot.  There are so many apps on it that it makes it fun as well.  I watch Netflix, Hulu and Amazon Prime on it all the time as well as dvd's and all work seamlessly.  We hooked it up with Sono's speaker and love them together.  Picture and sound can't be beat!

Reviews.Title: Wish blacks were blacker and more uniform. User interface might be better.
Reviews.Author: Rafael Font Viera
Reviews.Content: Purchased it for my dorm. Screen size is adequate for the desk I put it on, but a larger screen might be even better to fully take advantage of its very high resolution. Nice picture quality, except for deep blacks. This one doesn't have area backlight dimming and background light is not very uniform, and is a bit distracting on very dark scenes. User interface feels slow and sometimes unpredictable. Animations are slow and don't add much value. New remote with trackpad is not too responsive.

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN40F6400
Reviews.Author: Galileon "Galileon"
Reviews.Content: Love this TV!This replaces a six year old Panasonic 42 inch Plasma TV which consumed almost 4 times the energy and weighed twice as much! The picture quality is just as good on this Samsung and makes just as good a monitor for my computer gaming, with 3D capability as a bonus.

Reviews.Title: Price. Performance. Style.  Features
Reviews.Author: Mr. Quality Freak
Reviews.Content: It came down to this or the samsung 7 series which chrome bezel for me.  I'm really glad I didn't choose the more expensive route.  I didn't buy this from amazon, I picked it up at bestbuy as an open box item for $850.  It was listed for 1050 open box and then saw the guy grab the tag.  I asked why he said it was being discounted and price had to be adjusted.  Once I saw $850 my decision was over.Set up is a breeze.  There IS the slightest clouding to the top right of the screen. Iver VERY faint, but I'm OCD and cannot stand imperfections.  That said, I cannot notice it in any actual video besides when screen is black and lights are off.The features of this include smart apps with a dual core processor.  I'm very impressed.  Given the price, this thing puts out a very respectable picture, is ultra slim, costs little to nothing to run and has all the features I could want.Now if only the 75 version was on sale :)

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Jan Wade
Reviews.Content: This is my first move into network ready TV.  My last TV was a Samsung and was very good.  This TV has even better picture quality.  I am very pleased.

Reviews.Title: our third samsung
Reviews.Author: Page Stiger
Reviews.Content: If you buy the Cheetah Mounts ALAMLB articulating arm with it plan on going to the hardware store for longer screws.  TV is great, our third Samsung

Reviews.Title: Did not work for even one week
Reviews.Author: Paul "PJ"
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews about problems with this model and not having great picture quality.  Still I had good experience with my prior Samsung TV so I purchased the TV.  It was listed as an open box never plugged in.  It looked brand new and worked out of the box.  Not the best picture but acceptable for the bedroom late night TV watching.  About 1 hour into a movie the TV turned itself off, then back on and the off etc.  I finally had to unplug the TV as I could not shut the TV off.  I called Samsung for warranty service and am waiting for a tech to call and set up an appointment.  Fingers crossed!Samsung warrantee service replaced the main circuit board which appears to have fixed the problem.  Easy fix, fast too.  This is a known problem so the service tech came prepared with the correct replacement part.

Reviews.Title: not the best decision
Reviews.Author: jamie durbin
Reviews.Content: Tv was listed as being in pristine condition with all accessories. When I received the tv and turned it on I have swirl shadow lines on the left side of the screen as if the screen has been pushed on too hard. When I picked the tv up from the carrier the tv wasn't even strapped down to the pallet it was just sitting on it. I actually drove to the carrier to pick up the tv because even though it was prime shipping it was going to take over ten days to receive the tv if I would have chosen to have it delivered instead of driving an hour away to pick it up. My advice is to not purchase an item of such value that you can't really see before hand.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful Picture
Reviews.Author: Donna
Reviews.Content: Other than very occasional drop out of pixels during shows or a little uneven movement  during fast motion, the TV has a beautiful picture. 40 inch is more than sufficient for my small living room (I had a 27 inch before, which I was quite happy with).  The slimness of the set makes it easy to move by oneself.  I have not had the opportunity to utilize all the "Smart" features of the TV yet, although we did manage to show pictures from a cell phone direct to the TV wirelessly.  I was also able to connect wirelessly to my computer.  Unlike some others, I found nothing wrong with the sound; it at least equaled the quality of any of my prior TV's.

Reviews.Title: Best picture
Reviews.Author: Barbelou
Reviews.Content: This is my first Samsung TV and it is wonderful picture quality, functionality are amazing. Smart functionality is a plus, Facebook, Netflix, Pandora... you name it is right there. One thing you need  to pay attention do not install facing a window you will have issue with glare that's the only con I have. It is great.

Reviews.Title: Samsung  flat screen  smart HDTV 55-inch on a stand or can be wall mounted
Reviews.Author: Gail Nickle
Reviews.Content: Need better instructions on how to use this and the remote.  Difficult to plug other devices into once its hung up. i Has a good picture.

Reviews.Title: Nice picture, easy set up, good value
Reviews.Author: John B
Reviews.Content: The picture on the Samsung is the best in this price range in my experience.  Set up was easy, Amazon included 30 days of tech help but it was not needed.  I purchased this with the Samsung HW-F450 Soundbar.  The only thing that keeps this from a five star rating is the poor synchronization between the remote controls and components.  I purposely bought all Samsung components to avoid these issues. Overall, just a minor annoyance.

Reviews.Title: Another great Samsung
Reviews.Author: Roger
Reviews.Content: Great HDTV, outstanding resolution.  Our previous large screen was Samsung too, 5 yrs. old, never a minute's problem.  Had this one for nearly a year and absolutely no complaints.  Will buy Samsung again.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV
Reviews.Author: Scott V
Reviews.Content: I have owned this TV for 10 months and I am very happy with it. I have had no problems with reliability or quality so far. The picture is very high quality but may require some initial tuning to get it right. I don't mind doing this, but if you do then you may want to pay someone to do this for you or have a tech friend come over for a TV party LOL.If I had to complain about this TV it would be about the sound. It is really is not up to par with the rest of the TV. I might even call it borderline. I, however, am used to high quality systems so maybe I am picky. Fortunately there are lots of sound bars out there so my advice is plan on buying one. This is an easy fix and maybe the right way to go anyway with these thin LED TVs.The remote control is also kind of odd. I have gotten used to it and I don't mind. My wife doesn't care for it. This is a smart TV so I can see why they tried this type of track pad remote and it works pretty good for this use. Once again, you can get another (universal) remote of your choice if needed. I don't use this remote enough to think about it. We have Direct TV and use that remote 90% of the time.I happy with this TV and would buy it again. It may be priced higher than other TVs but it is worth it to me. This will hold me over until the 4k TV prices come down some more.I hope this helps you out...

Reviews.Title: Fantastic
Reviews.Author: nutjobs
Reviews.Content: Better then I expected.  Well worth the price.  I only have this tv a month,  I love it, can't wait to put it back on!

Reviews.Title: A great TV
Reviews.Author: Norman Torres
Reviews.Content: Very please with the TV. I like the features, 3D, Wifi, Smart TV , voice control.My wife was very please with the TV

Reviews.Title: great tv
Reviews.Author: Isaac A DuPont
Reviews.Content: Absolutely love this tv. Haven't had any of the issues that prior reviewers said they had. Works great for my games and movies. No framerate issues here. 3d affects are also a cool kicker. Did a lot of research before buying and have to say I'm glad i pulled the trigger on this buy. Highly recommend this tv for anyone looking

Reviews.Title: Awesome tv!
Reviews.Author: kevin dai
Reviews.Content: I had a 51in samsung plasma for a little over 2 yrs, however, the 51in felt a little small, so i been looking for a bigger tv for quiet some time; was a little torned between vizio and samsung at one point, but in the end, decided to go w/ the samsung UN65F6400 65in.after getting everything setup, i immediately noticed the difference in the picture quality.  The picture quality of the samsung plasma that i had was good, but the 65in is simply superb! just beyond my expectations.the smart tv was a little difficult to set up at the beginning, i didn't realize that you actually need to register w/ samsung first, before you can view the youtube videos and all the other contents.one little complain that i have: using the smart remote to type is simply a pain, you had to use your thumb to pick out each letter that you want to type on the screen's keyboard.  I mean when customers shed out almost 2 grand for a tv, we kinda demand perfection.  And there has to be a better way to type a url using the smart remote control.  If i really had a choice, i would have given a 4.5 rating instead of the 5/5.

Reviews.Title: Good HDTV but not smart enough
Reviews.Author: nysuka
Reviews.Content: Setup is easy, detects wifi, bluetooth pairing with keyboard and mouse, and 3D glasses with no issue. Popular apps like Netflix, Amazon, YouTube work well. Some reviewers complained about the stand being flimsy, but it is a fixed stand with no degree of freedom for swiveling so as long as the tv isn't moved too frequently, the stand should be stable enough, plus the tv isn't too heavy. Other reviewers mentioned the remote being difficult to use, but I find the design intuitive and its small (smaller than iphone).My main complaint is the browser, which is very slow, unresponsive sometimes, and playing flash video will sometimes cause the tv to reboot on its own. After some research, it turns out this sudden reboot happens when the tv runs out of memory. Also, free version of hulu.com will not play on the browser at all, displays error saying platform not supported. This is disappointing for a "smart tv". To make it actually "smart", I'll have to connect a laptop or pc to the tv.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV
Reviews.Author: A. North "a dreamer"
Reviews.Content: Love this TV!!! Read all the Amazon reviews numerous times, before making this purchase.  Amazon is the best place for honest reviews....Was hesitant about purchasing something this expensive and fragile with Amazon, but rest assured the packaging and delivery were top notch.  No nightmares here!!!!The TV is as good as people say and better.  I am still in awe of the picture quality!!!!  The depth and color is great!  I still have to fine tune some of the settings, but I did use some of the tips from reviewers here, that seem to have technology knowledge.  They did improve the quality of the color and image even more than the factory settings.  Excellent TV!!!

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV.
Reviews.Author: Ray Fish.
Reviews.Content: The display is one of the best I've ever seen. I like the samsung smart tv features, but I felt it lacked certain features.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for.
Reviews.Author: Ryan P Flynn
Reviews.Content: Color levels are excellent. Black levels are horrible. Back-light has very noticeable white patches around screen in dark scenes or letterbox type formats. Lots of nice apps. I made the mistake of not spending the extra money for the 7000 or 8000 series.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Picture Quality
Reviews.Author: D. D'Ambrosio
Reviews.Content: I had a very old TV before this so it's hard to compare but the picture quality is amazing.  We looked at a lot of TVs before settling on this one and it was the right choice.  The picture is so clear and bright and the huge screen makes it feel like you are right in the movie!

Reviews.Title: Excellent product.
Reviews.Author: Brandon M
Reviews.Content: This product has exceeded my expectations and I am looking forward to making more purchases in the future. It arrived as it was advertised and has been problem free.

Reviews.Title: like the televesion
Reviews.Author: Ryan Turnbull
Reviews.Content: awesome features. nice size nice to have wifi. resolution is nice as well. Great tv to use if you do not want cable.

Reviews.Title: Outperforms our other LED TVs!
Reviews.Author: G. K. Wallace
Reviews.Content: We have two other Samsung LED TVs, and this Samsung has made even more improvements since out last purchase.  I don't plan on using the 3D as we don't have a 3D DVD player, but the comb filters make it worth the extra $100.  Netflix loads much faster on this TV than from my Sony Blu Ray player.  The remote is small and easy to use with a "mouse" type feature touch pad.  The picture is super clear and the built in speakers with SRS is amazing!

Reviews.Title: purchased to go in Cabinet
Reviews.Author: Danny L. Demirjian "Camelacid"
Reviews.Content: Great picture, good sound, was a snap to set up, packaging was more than adiquate, fit and finish as well as quality was what I have come to expect from Samsung, This is my third  in the house now.

Reviews.Title: sweeeeeet
Reviews.Author: Kurtiss
Reviews.Content: I'm so glad I upgraded this tv is amazingly fun and way better picture than my LCD. The smartness of the tv gets a bit to get use to but after a few uses it's awesome NICE job Samsung

Reviews.Title: New
Reviews.Author: Brian Schwab
Reviews.Content: I love everything there is about this TV. I have it in my bedroom and it's a perfect size.The 3D works great and the sound is very good.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Tom Winscher
Reviews.Content: Excellent Product , The Smart features are fantastic. Runs Apps great,. And controls the setup box Well. So far there is nothing bad I can say about this TV would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN46F6400 46-Inch 1080p 120Hz 3D Slim Smart LED HDTV
Reviews.Author: andrew
Reviews.Content: Had vercion H5300 which for me was great now I've upgraded to this vercion the F6400 and I find super love the system has IMPROVEMENTS besides that memory is bigger to download a lot more apps and comtrol is more comfortable yet. . Good Holiday but I buy the keyboard for this vercion selling so enjoy the most of this fantastic tv

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: MJK "MJK"
Reviews.Content: Very happy, so far no problems. Such a huge difference over my 4 year old Samsung 40 inch. Enjoying the wireless bells and whistles. I did add a sound bar that completed a great package.

Reviews.Title: loving new tv
Reviews.Author: Crystal
Reviews.Content: I upgraded from a 32 inch to this tv. I was very happy to find a 3rd and smart tv with 100 I and 120 refresh rate for such a great price. I love all the functions. The only thing was a remote did not come with the tv. So, I contacted the company and they quickly sent me a remote.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for great price
Reviews.Author: Phaneender
Reviews.Content: Beautiful quality, very good 3D experience. Gives 2 pair of 3D glasses which are very light compared to others. Lot of connection options. Overall a good TV.

Reviews.Title: Very satisfied with TV
Reviews.Author: peter vitale
Reviews.Content: As I read previous reviews on this TV, I agree with the initial color is not good.  Once set up the picture is great.Have patience to set up the color. In my past experience the TV are set up with the color.

Reviews.Title: Gorgeous Picture!!
Reviews.Author: Rhonda Williams
Reviews.Content: Easy setup for someone who is electronically challenged and within minutes I was playing with the features and apps. But it is the picture that is truly the best feature. So clear that I had to check to see if I had it in 3-D mode.

Reviews.Title: A great buy.
Reviews.Author: David A. Harris "Dave Harris"
Reviews.Content: Great TV.  Wonderful picture and fairly easy to set up.  I haven't taken advantage of all the things it is capable of doing, but very satisfied so far.

Reviews.Title: smart tv is awesome
Reviews.Author: Enrique A Sanchez
Reviews.Content: Love it just wish the web browser was a little bit quicker but that might just be my ISP. Lol

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV, SmartHub can be slow at times
Reviews.Author: T. Koshy
Reviews.Content: Beautiful picture quality, great connections and very accessible. I was maybe expecting too much from the "smart" software; i found it to be kind of slow at times, but overall, I am very pleased with this purchase (first TV I ever bought) and will be buying this similar brand of Samsung TV's in the future.

Reviews.Title: very nice tv with all required options
Reviews.Author: Krish
Reviews.Content: nice tv for a moderate price and has good smart features especially if you have few other samsung products. However 3D is not very effective if you sit more than 2 meters range from TV which is little annoying...

Reviews.Title: Samsung smart tv
Reviews.Author: Tyler P.
Reviews.Content: This tv is way better than the Vizio that I had it takes some time getting use to the LED and 3d features but they are extremely great the picture is great on movies and for gaming

Reviews.Title: Beautiful!
Reviews.Author: Letha L Walls
Reviews.Content: The picture on this tv is unbelievable! Still getting it set up with various online services, but have played several movies from downloads on my media center --quality is spectacular even with that level of handicap. Nice for the price!

Reviews.Title: Excellent!
Reviews.Author: Manuel Espinosa
Reviews.Content: The equipment exceeded my expectations. The only thing is that hdmi cables, keyboard and everything else is extra and you have to buy it separately.

Reviews.Title: SAMSUNG TV
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer "if you dont know where your ...
Reviews.Content: im still getting to know it but it works great , the picture looks great and now i need to find a better internet connection to use all its features. .all in all im satisfied with the TV

Reviews.Title: best led hdtv in the market
Reviews.Author: albert
Reviews.Content: the samsung un40f6400 40 inch . Is the best led hdtv . It has three hdmi ,three usb ports and it is easy to install,and use

Reviews.Title: good choice for bedroom
Reviews.Author: L. Raasch
Reviews.Content: Great picture and features.  Like the automatic reaction to light feature. Easy to get to netflix and youtube.  Fits the space I have perfectly.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic picture including 3D feature
Reviews.Author: D. Green
Reviews.Content: Highly recommended.  easy to setup hub  wireless a little weak in my home location so connected to LAN to take best advantage of smart hub apps  Used Ethernet over power line to get from uverse router without issues. Remote takes some practice but some very nice features included.

Reviews.Title: we love the ease of connectivity
Reviews.Author: Nana2Sarah&Emily
Reviews.Content: This TV has way more features than we will use, but we love the ease of connectivity.  This model does not support Adobe Flash (I only tried once), so I can not play movies from some web sites, but it does Netflix, Amazon Prime, U-tube flawlessly.  Glad I went for the higher priced model as the processor is FAST

Reviews.Title: LOVE TV
Reviews.Author: candy
Reviews.Content: Love Love LOVE this tv!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! The best I have ever purchased- I need to take the time to check out all it has to offer!!

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Steve Wascak
Reviews.Content: TV is great. There is some flutter with quick movement but that's rare. Not worth it to me to spend extra money on a faster processor.(next model up) So far we're thrilled with the picture and looks.

Reviews.Title: Great buy!
Reviews.Author: gigi
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful picture.  It took a short time to acclimate myself to the remote control, but it's fine now.  I can't believe how many apps are on this TV!It took a bit of time to get the gist of the 3D, but I am sure glad I bought this TV.I am loving every minute......

Reviews.Title: Take my wife...not my TV
Reviews.Author: Rmsin Eshaya
Reviews.Content: My best purchase.  I'd give the wife the home and cars, but not my TV. This TV has it all.  Internet, crisp graphics, and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Great price, great features, great T.V.
Reviews.Author: YVM
Reviews.Content: The price for this t.v. was only slightly higher than the Samsung model below this one. Spending a little extra for so many more features was a no-brainer! The 3D feature wasn't on my radar when I was shopping. But once I got the t.v. home, it was one of the first features I tested, and I was blown away! Simply beautiful picture once it's calibrated. A great mix of free apps pre-loaded and simple to start using. The only thing I could down-rate for this model is the stand. I think it could use improvement for customers like myself, that do not have a wall to mount it to.

Reviews.Title: Excellent!!!
Reviews.Author: Javier J. Apitz Pulido
Reviews.Content: Excellent product. Nice pictures, easy to pair with WiFi network. Good sound quality,  very easy to use TV remote control.

Reviews.Title: Perfection!
Reviews.Author: Ashley22
Reviews.Content: super crispy clear awesome Smart 3D TV. I love all the apps that come with the TV. Seemless wifi and great streaming ability.

Reviews.Title: Amazing picture quality and features
Reviews.Author: alter
Reviews.Content: This tv is pretty Amazing. My old tv is a 50" Samsung plasma 720p. I'm still very happy with it and wasn't sure if I should get another plasma or this one. What made me get this one is where I would be placing it, in a room next to a sunroom, which had a lot of light in it. Since the LEDs are better suited for that, I went that route. I love the fact that is came with built-in WIFI so hooking it up to the LAN was a breeze and it can see my NAS drive, etc. I'm still adjusting to the touchpad remote, but its ok I guess, and kind of necessary to navigate and especially browse the web,etc. Watching videos, especially with lots of motion, looks spectacular. Motions look so fluid and realistic almost like its in 3d. I believe this is due to the 120hz refresh. I use the tv for mostly over the air antenna to watch local stations in HD and Netflix. I'm really looking forward to trying out the 3d, which is a feature that I almost didn't realize came with this tv. It definitely wouldn't be something I pay extra for but now that I have it, I will check it out. The tv is relatively light for its size and also pretty thin. I have it mounted on a wall with a Cheetah 32-55 inch articulating wall mount which I also purchased on Amazon. Overall I would not hesitate to recommend this tv to others even though I've only owned it a couple months and haven't really used it all that much or all of its features yet. I will update the review when I do.

Reviews.Title: I'm a slow learner
Reviews.Author: Robert P. Corbett
Reviews.Content: Remote is designed for Touch and this was new to me. The Manual is built into the TV and I had difficulty tuning in the Manual. Finally got help.Still haven't learned how to transfer movies or programs from my computer to the TV....but I will.

Reviews.Title: awesome tv at the best price! only from amazon!!
Reviews.Author: DJ
Reviews.Content: I dont know why this was returned, but Im sooo glad!! I got a brand new 3d 50" smart tv for half the cost & free shipping!! Its awesome!!! Voice activated!! Great picture!! Volume sucks, but I got a matching bar from amazon cheaper than everyone else too. First flatscreen, cant beat it!!

Reviews.Title: Some Flaws but Overall a very Good TV for the Price
Reviews.Author: R. Kirkes
Reviews.Content: UN55F6400 has a nice sharp picture and good SMART TV features. I found the MOVIE picture setting to be the best with the Auto Motion Plus (only if you are viewing in 2D) turned off. The picture quality does suffer if you are viewing it from too severe a side angle so this is a TV that is best viewed from front angles. The 2D to 3D conversion feature is also nice in that it actually produces acceptable viewing results. Another nice feature is that this TV has ample ports for HDMI, USB, and Audio Out.The sound quality I cannot comment on as I run it through my Yamaha Receiver to external speakers. I will say though that this TV does have a design flaw with how it handles input signals. If I run the input signal directly from my DISH Receiver to the TV, I get both picture and sound. However, if I run the DISH Receiver to my Yamaha Receiver and then to the TV, the TV will only get the picture. Thus, if you want to utilize an external receiver along with retaining the ability for this TV to produce sound, you are limited to the following setup: DISH Receiver to Samsung TV to External Receiver.The remote control too has the same issue. If you want it to control your DISH Receiver, you must have the same setup wherein the DISH is connected directly to the TV.Nonetheless, all in all this is a very good TV for the price.

Reviews.Title: Image quality is great!
Reviews.Author: Mildred
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband were both satisfied with the image quality especially when we are using the 3D and pair it with our Samsung Bluray 3D player and 3D glasses it feels like we are in a theater!

Reviews.Title: Great TV (edited)
Reviews.Author: N. Abels
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice TV. It's natively compatible with a lot of file types, and using Plex and Mezzmo as media streamers has been a breeze. The picture quality is also great, and the WiFi connects to everything seamlessly. Really, the only problem is that the semi-matte finish used on the screen reflects a moderate amount of light. Although the higher end Samsung models use a different, clear-coat finish, I've read articles that indicate it's still an issue there too. As with my monitor, I would have preferred if they had sacrificed some screen clarity for less glare.Besides that, there are a few quirks. When loading the Smart Hub, there's some noticeable lag, and it's annoying how you can't change the volume while browsing through menus. The remote is also kind of difficult to use and lacking in functionality. These aren't big issues though, and some of them may be fixable with software updates.Edit: I took a star off due to screen uniformity issues after noticing dark corners. It's easy to make out these kinds of backlighting problems if you take a picture of the TV while a white image is displayed (that covers the entire screen) and then compare it to a picture of the TV after selecting 'setup' from the menu options. I was already aware that all four corners of my screen were too dark during lightly colored scenes, but hadn't noticed other uniformity issues, such as darkness creeping across the bottom middle. Using Google, it seems this started becoming a problem around 2009, when Samsung was first introducing edge-lit TVs. I'm having a technician replace the screen, and will update then.Edit 2: The tech came and replaced the screen. He noted that the manufacturing number of the replacement screen wasn't the same as the original screen, meaning it may be updated somehow. The darkness in the corners is still noticeable to an extent, but much less so than before. I'm still leaving a star off because the many cheap Vizio's in my bedrooms have flawless backlighting and uniformity, meaning it's a goal that should be attainable.

Reviews.Title: Good TV, crappy remote.
Reviews.Author: Ko
Reviews.Content: The images are bright, clean, and crisp.  The TV handles motion pretty well.  I don't really use the 3-D, but it does work.The remote sucks, though.  They put the power button directly above the volume button, so I often turn the TV off instead of turning the volume up.  The smart TV functions work, but are VERY slow and choppy.

Reviews.Title: Best value in a 3D 50" with all the main features, no excessive extra features, although the talk to control feature is awesome
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "SFX guy"
Reviews.Content: Best value in a 3D 50" with all the main features, no excessive extra features, although the talk to control feature is awesome.quality picture, decent sound although who doesnt use and amp and speakers these days/highly recommend

Reviews.Title: Good TV for the money
Reviews.Author: Ronald P Sponaugle
Reviews.Content: The Samsung meets my needs. Love the access to the internet. Picture quality seems to be very good. The slimness of the screen is very practical.Con: The TV has a lot of technical feature, so you should be somewhat tech oriented to use a lot of the features. Voice directed function not as good as expecred

Reviews.Title: Great buy from Samsung.
Reviews.Author: Travis
Reviews.Content: Love this TV very much.  Makes playing my PC games, watching movies, and everything else so much better.  I can plug my external HDD to this tv and it will read it no problem and play all types of media on it.  I have a Samsung S4 and can mirror my screen onto the TV without any problem.  Cheetah mounts will work for this to mount on the wall.  Setup was easy and updating took a lil bit due to my slow connection in Afghanistan.  Love the remote that came with this tv.  Easy to use, voice activated and so far no issues with it.

Reviews.Title: Great Purchase & Amazing TV
Reviews.Author: Brandon
Reviews.Content: For this being my first 3D Smart TV I'm extremely impressed. I purchased this to upgrade my 4 year old 26" Samsung HDTV and all I can say is wow. I play a lot of video games, console and pc, and they look amazing on this. The 120Hz really smooth the graphics out. My gaming pc has a 60Hz monitor which is great but playing them on a 120Hz screen is a difference. Even some of my older ps3  and xbox 360 games look really good compared to my 26" tv. As for the smart functions I really like it. Haven't run into any issues with the apps crashing and everything has worked great. 3D is nice too but I can't sit for a long period of time without getting a slight headache. Glad I went with another Samsung since I haven't run into any problems with them yet.  I would definitely recommend this someone looking for a new tv or to upgrade an older one.

Reviews.Title: Only One Problem
Reviews.Author: ILoveTheUSA
Reviews.Content: I have owned this tv for almost 6 months now and I'm very happy with it.  The picture on this tv is excellent, there is no noticeable blurring during fast action, and the colors are vibrant.  The 3D is awesome with very clear pictures and real depth.  The smart function works well although I don't use it too often because I have a HTPC hooked up to it.  Sound from the stock speakers is terrible on this Samsung so you do need a separate set up like a sound bar at the least.  The one issue I don't like, and why I removed one star, is that there is a "ghosting" or "light bleed" issue when viewing in a very dark room.  It is not an issue during scenes that are bright or just normal but if a scene in a movie or show is very dark I can see blotches of light in certain areas.  The areas don't change so it is the tv, and my settings are not excessively bright although when I turned them down it helped a little but I like a bright screen.  I am surprised more people haven't mentioned this here but I guess I'm very observant and pick out the details.  Overall I am pleased with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Smart TV
Reviews.Author: AQUILL MARTIN
Reviews.Content: Great Picture.  The sound and picture is everything you could want in a tv. We really haven't used the 3D yet because there are not a lot of stuff in 3d.

Reviews.Title: Works great but slow
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: It's a pain having to wait for things to load, but the picture is nice.  I guess we should have bought the quad-core.  Also would have been nice it the remote included a number pad.

Reviews.Title: Great tv
Reviews.Author: Talmadge Cain
Reviews.Content: I am really enjoying this tv.  I like the Smart tv part of it but really wish that there was more 3d content available

Reviews.Title: Samsung wins
Reviews.Author: Kyle
Reviews.Content: Definetely worth the extra money over lower models. picture is amazing, samsung always impresses.  My family bought a JVC smart tv at costco and i can say my samsung makes it look like a tube tv in comparison.

Reviews.Title: Simple and Eloquent
Reviews.Author: my facebook
Reviews.Content: I really like this TV. Great engineering, simple but eloquent in every detail. I needed a Blue Ray layer after this YV purchase so didn't hesitate to put Samsung brand as a top priority. I forgot the model player I ended up purchasing, but it was the Samsung brand and it's just want I wanted. Again, simple but eloquent throughout every detail!

Reviews.Title: Great TV set and easy to operate.
Reviews.Author: Ulises J. Pesce "UP"
Reviews.Content: The TV set is great. The quality of the image is excellent and Amazon service "THE BEST".My package came on time and intact. Nevertheless after removing the set from the package I notice a little crack on the frame of the TV. I contacted Amazon at 7 or 8 PM and they said there were going to replace the unit and gave me instructions to send the defective one back. Around 10 AM or 32 hours after contacted Amazon I had the new set at my door. Later that afternoon UPS picked up the damaged set. I buy everything from Amazon, the service is the best. Going back to the TV set it performs as expected. The colors are intense and natural, the audio is good enough for a bedroom so I'm not attaching external speakers. I'm very satisfied with my purchase and happy to have bought it from Amazon.

Reviews.Title: I love it! Great TV
Reviews.Author: Hossein ghassempour Aghamolki
Reviews.Content: I bought my TV one month ago and believe me, It's fantastic. HD quality is perfect, brightness is wonderful and It's 3D works very well. Besides, Samsung smart feature is amazing.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price!
Reviews.Author: BeauzerC
Reviews.Content: Great picture and smart features are great!  This 55 inch fits perfect in our bonus room and we love to watch movies on it!

Reviews.Title: Works great, great picture and depth
Reviews.Author: Louise Swartswalter
Reviews.Content: Works great, clear picture, easy to navigate, easy to install on wall, using it to display biofeedback program and pictures, literature in Natural health office

Reviews.Title: Better than expected.
Reviews.Author: Dong Oh
Reviews.Content: It is wonderful TV. The picture quality is extraordinary.  I am very happy to get it even though it is somewhat pricy. I think it is worthwhile. I tried a Sony 70" but I had to return because the picture quality was so poor. I am really happy with this TV.

Reviews.Title: Very good picture
Reviews.Author: Jack W. Nelemans "Jacknel"
Reviews.Content: This is beyond my expectations, and worked great right out of the box with no adjustments needed. Viewing pictures and videos, and listening to music stored on my computer was very simple to program, with a simple Samsung program to download to computer. Remote is easy to use and works well.Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Very good tv.
Reviews.Author: felix
Reviews.Content: I love this tv, my old samsung was a 32 inch LCD with 62hz refresh and no 3D images and it was a surprise the change in every way!

Reviews.Title: Samsung LED looks great and puts out much less heat than LCD units
Reviews.Author: Skydog
Reviews.Content: I went from a 640 series LCD to the new UN46F6400 and couldn't be happier. I also bought the Yamaha RX-V675 receiver and tied it all together with a Logitech 915-000194 Harmony Smart Control with Smartphone App and Simple Remote. I use the Smart TV apps, but disabled them from appearing every time I turn my units on; I would have dropped to four stars if Samsung had not made this a possible change.

Reviews.Title: samsung un40f6400
Reviews.Author: kenfischer
Reviews.Content: best tv on market. Great picture,easy to use.This is my fourth Samsung tv and in four years not one problem.

Reviews.Title: It's a very Good smart
Reviews.Author: Srini
Reviews.Content: It's a very Good smart 3D TV, I am happy with this TV.  Compared to LG this has very good features and also it looks very good.

Reviews.Title: very nice TV
Reviews.Author: Monique
Reviews.Content: Has everything we wanted, smart tv, great picture, reasonable price.  Overall a really great tv, and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: 46-inch set : Good product, excellent picture quality
Reviews.Author: Shubham
Reviews.Content: It has been about a month since we owned this, and so far we have been extremely satisfied with the purchase.. we upgraded from an old CRT model, so the difference has been pretty good.. we have not yet explored the 3D picture, but the normal 2D is what we would anyway watch most of the time and it certainly meets our expectations.. the setup was easy and with the Amazon technical support it became easier.. the screen size is perfect in our living room setup and provides a great viewing experience... whatever apps we tried so far are just fine and no connectivity issues so far...  still early days, but based on what I have seen so far.. recommended !!

Reviews.Title: Giving 4 stars now after a lot of experimenting...
Reviews.Author: Susan Wright
Reviews.Content: Smart Hub is stupidly slow. Lost internet connections during a 48-minute show added 15 minutes to viewing time. I have an iPhone, iPad, MacBook Pro, iMac. None of them ever lose connectivity in a 3600 sq ft house. Tiny remote is difficult to use, as is tiny print on on-screen control. Lack of manual makes help difficult. On the PLUS side, gorgeous picture, sound is satisfactory.  Haven't used 3D yet. Wondering if I'll have to go back to my iPad & Apple TV for an excellent streaming experience!Only Amazon Prime constantly lost internet connection! Netflix & Hulu+ stream just fine. Also, I can hook my Apple TV back up if I need to. Changed rating from initial 3 stars to 4. Long learning curve on remote and on screen functions, but am catching on. Also researched all 39-42" TVs, and only 2 come close, and they are nearly the same in price w/o as many features. I think it's a keeper after all.Bought TV from Beach Camera through Amazon. They get a 10 for customer service.

Reviews.Title: Best gaming TV at 75 inches
Reviews.Author: Brae L. Hulery "Braehole"
Reviews.Content: Not sure how many twitch gamers are looking at this TV but input lag time matters for FPS and online fighting games. This TV is the lowest (so far)for 75 inch HDTV in the great category at 39ms. Bad input lag means you or your kid will get shot before he sees it on the screen. Not fun for gaming if you have bad input lag, so if you or your kids play lots of games online check out these two sites to find a TV for both movies and gaming. How wants to spend 3-4k on a TV and not be able to use it for everything? Hope this helps!With the new consoles coming towards the end of the year, marketing low input lag TVs and their gaming advantages could be a smart opportunity for a savvy TV manufacturer.I wonder if any manufacturer company guys look at these comments....[...][...]

Reviews.Title: The tv that does everything
Reviews.Author: halodadson "Timothy R Ferguson"
Reviews.Content: If you want to be able to talk to your tv and have it talk back and obey your commands and do just about everything you can think of, this is the tv for you. You can change the channel with the motion of your hand or call out the channel you want, check the internet, net flix, fuse with your LG home theater system as if it were Samsung and view a near perfect picture. This Samsung cost me $1849.00 and is worth every penny of it. It turns on by itself at 6:00 AM and turns itself off at 10:00 PM. I`m an LG fan but this UN65F6400 is every bit as good as any LG product I`ve had.

Reviews.Title: Bad customer service
Reviews.Author: OJO STEPHEN
Reviews.Content: I have been buying all my stuffs on amazon, samsung has an extremely terrible customer service. I bought this TV and by the time i opened it, i saw a crack inside the TV and could not use it for 1min as the screen did not respond. I called samsung and all i was told was to go buy another TV that it was not covered by the warranty. This is an extreme rip off. I bought a TV that I never used and thats all i get from samsung. I would never recommend samsung product to anyone, not because its not good but because of their customer service. they are so insensitive and do not care about their customers especially when you have bought their product. All they want is for customers to buy their products and do not really care how they fare. Thats terrible.

Reviews.Title: Mixed review as I had to have it repaired in warranty
Reviews.Author: Lea Morgan
Reviews.Content: I really liked the TV until six months after I bought it the TV started to turn on and off repeatedly without me doing it. I followed all the recommended troubleshooting steps, called Samsung, and they said it needed a repair person. The good thing is this repairman called me the same day and will come out to pick the TV up and take it to his shop for a few days--so, obviously, I will be without a TV for that time. I am disappointed because, apparently, this is a common problem that I didn't hear about when I was researching the TV. At this point, I hope the repair will not take too long!

Reviews.Title: Great picture
Reviews.Author: Ryan Kelly
Reviews.Content: This TV has a fantastic picture, and represents 3D imagery very well.  I've paired it with a Yamaha RX-V673 and am experiencing ONE issue that appears to have no solution when contacting Samsung directly.  When using the Audio Return Channel (ARC) over HDMI, the TV forces the receiver into the TVs sound input when turning it on.  This is frustrating when switching the devices on first thing in the morning, as I'll hear sound from whatever source I've selected, then nothing.  Manually changing the source back to the correct one solves the problem, but only for that viewing period.  I've not found a permanent solution to this problem, and Samsung has been less than helpful.

Reviews.Title: This TV is LE-GIT
Reviews.Author: Serkan
Reviews.Content: I didn't buy this TV from Amazon, I bought it at Best Buy but I'm telling you, im not all high tech kind of person, but this technology and the way everything is bundled on this TV is... freaking incredible! I highly recommend this TV, especially for this price! YOU WILL NOT BE DISAPPOINTED, do not listen to other people crying about the quality or complications or this and that,buy this TV if you can, it's worth it!

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN46F6400 is just BRILLIANT.
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Delgado "K9 Krunchies"
Reviews.Content: Why this TV's so Epic.-Picture Quality-3D, 2D to 3D conversion makes ANYTHING 3D.-Size, weight, thin-Connects with my Note 2, allshare cast enables mirroring with your phone (amazing for games like GTA) and sketchbook pro.-Connecting my 3tb external (Samsung D3 Station), allows me to view mkvs up to 50gb PERFECTLY (thanks to dual core).-Comes with 2 3D glasses for you and your lady!Seriously, check out this TV it's HEAVY DUTY. Xbox looks crazy, especially once you tweak the picture settings.

Reviews.Title: Nice, BUT!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Arthur L. Usher "Sonny"
Reviews.Content: I bought this smart tv as a second.  The first flat panel that I bought is a Samsung LN40 series and does not have smart capabilities but is a very nice HD tv.  So when something works great keep supporting the company.  Correct?  The UN 46 is has very pretty picture and great HD as long as you are looking at it straight on. If you move about 20 degrees to either side the picture quality is not as good and the definitions lightens up.  The LN40 has a side view that is much greater somewhere about 70 degrees.  The sound on the UN46 is a touch better than the LN40 but I use a surround sound system and this does not matter but just stating. The smart is remote is very nice and well designed and easy to navigate. The 3D ability is okay, not much on 3D but fun to play with.  My biggest kicker is the web browser.
